00089 #define MAX_THREADS 4096
00090 #define MAX_BASE_ID 0xffffffff
00091 #define NIDSTRING_LENGTH 64
00092 struct shared_data {
00093         pthread_mutex_t mutex;
00094         pthread_cond_t  cond;
00095         int       stopping;
00096         struct {
00097                 __u64 counters[MAX_THREADS];
00098                 __u64 offsets[MAX_THREADS];
00099                 int   thr_running;
00100                 int   start_barrier;
00101                 int   stop_barrier;
00102                 struct timeval start_time;
00103                 struct timeval end_time;
00104         } body;
00105 };
00106

00109 static int prev_valid;

00115 const int nthreads = 1;

00122         return l_ioctl(dev_id, opc, buf);

00125 int lcfg_ioctl(char * func, int dev_id, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00126 {
00127         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
00128         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
00129         int rc;
00130 
00131         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00132         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
00133         data.ioc_type = LUSTRE_CFG_TYPE;
00134         data.ioc_plen1 = lustre_cfg_len(lcfg->lcfg_bufcount,
00135                                         lcfg->lcfg_buflens);
00136         data.ioc_pbuf1 = (void *)lcfg;
00137         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
00138         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00139         if (rc) {
00140                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
00141                         jt_cmdname(func));
00142                 return rc;
00143         }
00144 
00145         rc =  l_ioctl(dev_id, OBD_IOC_PROCESS_CFG, buf);
00146 
00147         return rc;
00148 }

00150 static int do_device(char *func, char *devname);

00152 static int get_mgs_device()
00153 {
00154         char mgs[] = "$MGS";
00155         static int mgs_device = -1;
00156 
00157         if (mgs_device == -1) {
00158                 int rc;
00159                 do_disconnect(NULL, 1);
00160                 rc = do_device("mgsioc", mgs);
00161                 if (rc) {
00162                         fprintf(stderr,
00163                                 "This command must be run on the MGS.\n");
00164                         errno = ENODEV;
00165                         return -1;
00166                 }
00167                 mgs_device = cur_device;
00168         }
00169         return mgs_device;
00170 }
00171 
00172 /* Returns -1 on error with errno set */
00173 int lcfg_mgs_ioctl(char *func, int dev_id, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00174 {
00175         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
00176         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
00177         int rc;
00178 
00179         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00180         rc = data.ioc_dev = get_mgs_device();
00181         if (rc < 0)
00182                 goto out;
00183         data.ioc_type = LUSTRE_CFG_TYPE;
00184         data.ioc_plen1 = lustre_cfg_len(lcfg->lcfg_bufcount,
00185                                         lcfg->lcfg_buflens);
00186         data.ioc_pbuf1 = (void *)lcfg;
00187         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
00188         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00189         if (rc) {
00190                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
00191                         jt_cmdname(func));
00192                 return rc;
00193         }
00194 
00195         rc = l_ioctl(dev_id, OBD_IOC_PARAM, buf);
00196 out:
00197         if (rc) {
00198                 if (errno == ENOSYS)
00199                         fprintf(stderr, "Make sure cfg_device is set first.\n");
00200         }
00201         return rc;
00202 }

00204 char *obdo_print(struct obdo *obd)
00205 {
00206         char buf[1024];
00207 
00208         snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "id: %#jx\ngrp: %#jx\natime: %ju\n"
00209                  "mtime: %ju\nctime: %ju\nsize: %ju\nblocks: %ju"
00210                  "\nblksize: %u\nmode: %o\nuid: %d\ngid: %d\nflags: %x\n"
00211                  "misc: %x\nnlink: %d,\nvalid %#jx\n",
00212                  (uintmax_t)ostid_id(&obd->o_oi),
00213                  (uintmax_t)ostid_seq(&obd->o_oi),
00214                  (uintmax_t)obd->o_atime, (uintmax_t)obd->o_mtime,
00215                  (uintmax_t)obd->o_ctime, (uintmax_t)obd->o_size,
00216                  (uintmax_t)obd->o_blocks, obd->o_blksize, obd->o_mode,
00217                  obd->o_uid, obd->o_gid, obd->o_flags, obd->o_misc,
00218                  obd->o_nlink, (uintmax_t)obd->o_valid);
00219         return strdup(buf);
00220 }

00222 
00223 #define BAD_VERBOSE (-999999999)
00224 
00225 #define N2D_OFF 0x100      /* So we can tell between error codes and devices */
00226 
00227 static int do_name2dev(char *func, char *name)
00228 {
00229         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
00230         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
00231         int rc;
00232 
00233         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00234         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
00235         data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(name) + 1;
00236         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = name;
00237 
00238         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
00239         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00240         if (rc < 0) {
00241                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
00242                         jt_cmdname(func));
00243                 return -rc;
00244         }
00245         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_NAME2DEV, buf);
00246         if (rc < 0)
00247                 return errno;
00248         rc = obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00249         if (rc) {
00250                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid reply\n",
00251                         jt_cmdname(func));
00252                 return rc;
00253         }
00254 
00255         return data.ioc_dev + N2D_OFF;
00256 }
00257 
00258 /*
00259  * resolve a device name to a device number.
00260  * supports a number, $name or %uuid.
00261  */
00262 int parse_devname(char *func, char *name)
00263 {
00264         int rc;
00265         int ret = -1;
00266 
00267         if (!name)
00268                 return ret;
00269         if (isdigit(name[0])) {
00270                 ret = strtoul(name, NULL, 0);
00271         } else {
00272                 if (name[0] == '$' || name[0] == '%')
00273                         name++;
00274                 rc = do_name2dev(func, name);
00275                 if (rc >= N2D_OFF) {
00276                         ret = rc - N2D_OFF;
00277                         // printf("Name %s is device %d\n", name, ret);
00278                 } else {
00279                         fprintf(stderr, "No device found for name %s: %s\n",
00280                                 name, strerror(rc));
00281                 }
00282         }
00283         return ret;
00284 }
00285 
00286 char *jt_cmdname(char *func)
00287 {
00288         static char buf[512];
00289 
00290         if (thread) {
00291                 sprintf(buf, "%s-%d", func, thread);
00292                 return buf;
00293         }
00294 
00295         return func;
00296 }
00297 
00298 #define difftime(a, b)                                  \
00299         ((a)->tv_sec - (b)->tv_sec +                    \
00300          ((a)->tv_usec - (b)->tv_usec) / 1000000.0)
00301 
00302 static int be_verbose(int verbose, struct timeval *next_time,
00303                       __u64 num, __u64 *next_num, int num_total)
00304 {
00305         struct timeval now;
00306 
00307         if (!verbose)
00308                 return 0;
00309 
00310         if (next_time != NULL)
00311                 gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
00312 
00313         /* A positive verbosity means to print every X iterations */
00314         if (verbose > 0 && (num >= *next_num || num >= num_total)) {
00315                 *next_num += verbose;
00316                 if (next_time) {
00317                         next_time->tv_sec = now.tv_sec - verbose;
00318                         next_time->tv_usec = now.tv_usec;
00319                 }
00320                 return 1;
00321         }
00322 
00323         /* A negative verbosity means to print at most each X seconds */
00324         if (verbose < 0 && next_time != NULL &&
00325             difftime(&now, next_time) >= 0.0){
00326                 next_time->tv_sec = now.tv_sec - verbose;
00327                 next_time->tv_usec = now.tv_usec;
00328                 *next_num = num;
00329                 return 1;
00330         }
00331 
00332         return 0;
00333 }
00334 
00335 static int get_verbose(char *func, const char *arg)
00336 {
00337         int verbose;
00338         char *end;
00339 
00340         if (!arg || arg[0] == 'v')
00341                 verbose = 1;
00342         else if (arg[0] == 's' || arg[0] == 'q')
00343                 verbose = 0;
00344         else {
00345                 verbose = (int)strtoul(arg, &end, 0);
00346                 if (*end) {
00347                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad verbose option '%s'\n",
00348                                 jt_cmdname(func), arg);
00349                         return BAD_VERBOSE;
00350                 }
00351         }
00352 
00353         if (verbose < 0)
00354                 printf("Print status every %d seconds\n", -verbose);
00355         else if (verbose == 1)
00356                 printf("Print status every operation\n");
00357         else if (verbose > 1)
00358                 printf("Print status every %d operations\n", verbose);
00359 
00360         return verbose;
00361 }
00362 
00363 int do_disconnect(char *func, int verbose)
00364 {
00365         lcfg_set_devname(NULL);
00366         cur_device = -1;
00367         return 0;
00368 }

00370 #ifdef MAX_THREADS
00371 static int shmem_setup(void)
00372 {
00373         pthread_mutexattr_t mattr;
00374         pthread_condattr_t  cattr;
00375         int                 rc;
00376         int                 shmid;
00377 
00378         /* Create new segment */
00379         shmid = shmget(IPC_PRIVATE, sizeof(*shared_data), 0600);
00380         if (shmid == -1) {
00381                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't create shared data: %s\n",
00382                         strerror(errno));
00383                 return errno;
00384         }
00385 
00386         /* Attatch to new segment */
00387         shared_data = (struct shared_data *)shmat(shmid, NULL, 0);
00388 
00389         if (shared_data == (struct shared_data *)(-1)) {
00390                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't attach shared data: %s\n",
00391                         strerror(errno));
00392                 shared_data = NULL;
00393                 return errno;
00394         }
00395 
00396         /* Mark segment as destroyed, so it will disappear when we exit.
00397          * Forks will inherit attached segments, so we should be OK.
00398          */
00399         if (shmctl(shmid, IPC_RMID, NULL) == -1) {
00400                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't destroy shared data: %s\n",
00401                         strerror(errno));
00402                 return errno;
00403         }
00404 
00405         pthread_mutexattr_init(&mattr);
00406         pthread_condattr_init(&cattr);
00407 
00408         rc = pthread_mutexattr_setpshared(&mattr, PTHREAD_PROCESS_SHARED);
00409         if (rc != 0) {
00410                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't set shared mutex attr\n");
00411                 goto out;
00412         }
00413 
00414         rc = pthread_condattr_setpshared(&cattr, PTHREAD_PROCESS_SHARED);
00415         if (rc != 0) {
00416                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't set shared cond attr\n");
00417                 goto out;
00418         }
00419 
00420         pthread_mutex_init(&shared_data->mutex, &mattr);
00421         pthread_cond_init(&shared_data->cond, &cattr);
00422 out:
00423         pthread_mutexattr_destroy(&mattr);
00424         pthread_condattr_destroy(&cattr);
00425 
00426         return rc;
00427 }
00428 
00429 static inline void shmem_lock(void)
00430 {
00431         pthread_mutex_lock(&shared_data->mutex);
00432 }
00433 
00434 static inline void shmem_unlock(void)
00435 {
00436         pthread_mutex_unlock(&shared_data->mutex);
00437 }
00438 
00439 static inline void shmem_wait(void)
00440 {
00441         pthread_cond_wait(&shared_data->cond, &shared_data->mutex);
00442 }
00443 
00444 static inline void shmem_wakeup_all(void)
00445 {
00446         pthread_cond_broadcast(&shared_data->cond);
00447 }
00448 
00449 static inline void shmem_reset(int total_threads)
00450 {
00451         if (shared_data == NULL)
00452                 return;
00453 
00454         memset(&shared_data->body, 0, sizeof(shared_data->body));
00455         memset(counter_snapshot, 0, sizeof(counter_snapshot));
00456         prev_valid = 0;
00457         shared_data->stopping = 0;
00458         shared_data->body.start_barrier = total_threads;
00459         shared_data->body.stop_barrier = total_threads;
00460 }
00461 
00462 static inline void shmem_bump(__u32 counter)
00463 {
00464         static bool running_not_bumped = true;
00465 
00466         if (shared_data == NULL || thread <= 0 || thread > MAX_THREADS)
00467                 return;
00468 
00469         shmem_lock();
00470         shared_data->body.counters[thread - 1] += counter;
00471         if (running_not_bumped) {
00472                 shared_data->body.thr_running++;
00473                 running_not_bumped = false;
00474         }
00475         shmem_unlock();
00476 }
00477 
00478 static void shmem_total(int total_threads)
00479 {
00480         __u64 total = 0;
00481         double secs;
00482         int i;
00483 
00484         if (shared_data == NULL || total_threads > MAX_THREADS)
00485                 return;
00486 
00487         shmem_lock();
00488         for (i = 0; i < total_threads; i++)
00489                 total += shared_data->body.counters[i];
00490 
00491         secs = difftime(&shared_data->body.end_time,
00492                         &shared_data->body.start_time);
00493         shmem_unlock();
00494 
00495         printf("Total: total %ju threads %d sec %f %f/second\n",
00496                (uintmax_t)total, total_threads, secs, total / secs);
00497 
00498         return;
00499 }
00500 
00501 static void shmem_snap(int total_threads, int live_threads)
00502 {
00503         struct timeval this_time;
00504         int non_zero = 0;
00505         __u64 total = 0;
00506         double secs;
00507         int running;
00508         int i;
00509 
00510         if (shared_data == NULL || total_threads > MAX_THREADS)
00511                 return;
00512 
00513         shmem_lock();
00514         memcpy(counter_snapshot[0], shared_data->body.counters,
00515                total_threads * sizeof(counter_snapshot[0][0]));
00516         running = shared_data->body.thr_running;
00517         shmem_unlock();
00518 
00519         gettimeofday(&this_time, NULL);
00520 
00521         for (i = 0; i < total_threads; i++) {
00522                 long long this_count =
00523                         counter_snapshot[0][i] - counter_snapshot[1][i];
00524 
00525                 if (this_count != 0) {
00526                         non_zero++;
00527                         total += this_count;
00528                 }
00529         }
00530 
00531         secs = difftime(&this_time, &prev_time);
00532         if (prev_valid && secs > 1.0)    /* someone screwed with the time? */
00533                 printf("%d/%d Total: %f/second\n", non_zero, total_threads,
00534                        total / secs);
00535 
00536         memcpy(counter_snapshot[1], counter_snapshot[0],
00537                total_threads * sizeof(counter_snapshot[0][0]));
00538         prev_time = this_time;
00539         if (!prev_valid &&
00540             running == total_threads)
00541                 prev_valid = 1;
00542 }
00543 
00544 static void shmem_stop(void)
00545 {
00546         if (shared_data == NULL)
00547                 return;
00548 
00549         shared_data->stopping = 1;
00550 }
00551 
00552 static void shmem_cleanup(void)
00553 {
00554         if (shared_data == NULL)
00555                 return;
00556 
00557         shmem_stop();
00558 
00559         pthread_mutex_destroy(&shared_data->mutex);
00560         pthread_cond_destroy(&shared_data->cond);
00561 }
00562 
00563 static int shmem_running(void)
00564 {
00565         return (shared_data == NULL || !shared_data->stopping);
00566 }
00567 
00568 static void shmem_end_time_locked(void)
00569 {
00570         shared_data->body.stop_barrier--;
00571         if (shared_data->body.stop_barrier == 0)
00572                 gettimeofday(&shared_data->body.end_time, NULL);
00573 }
00574 
00575 static void shmem_start_time_locked(void)
00576 {
00577         shared_data->body.start_barrier--;
00578         if (shared_data->body.start_barrier == 0) {
00579                 shmem_wakeup_all();
00580                 gettimeofday(&shared_data->body.start_time, NULL);
00581         } else {
00582                 shmem_wait();
00583         }
00584 }

00612 static int shmem_running(void)

00614         return 1;

00618 extern command_t cmdlist[];
00619 
00620 static int do_device(char *func, char *devname)
00621 {
00622         int dev;
00623 
00624         dev = parse_devname(func, devname);
00625         if (dev < 0)
00626                 return -1;
00627 
00628         lcfg_set_devname(devname);
00629         cur_device = dev;
00630         return 0;
00631 }
00632 
00633 int jt_obd_get_device()
00634 {
00635         return cur_device;
00636 }
00637 
00638 int jt_obd_device(int argc, char **argv)
00639 {
00640         int rc;
00641 
00642         if (argc > 2)
00643                 return CMD_HELP;
00644 
00645         if (argc == 1) {
00646                 printf("current device is %d - %s\n",
00647                        cur_device, lcfg_get_devname() ? : "not set");
00648                 return 0;
00649         }
00650         rc = do_device("device", argv[1]);
00651         return rc;
00652 }
00653 
00654 int jt_opt_device(int argc, char **argv)
00655 {
00656         int ret;
00657         int rc;
00658 
00659         if (argc < 3)
00660                 return CMD_HELP;
00661 
00662         rc = do_device("device", argv[1]);
00663 
00664         if (!rc)
00665                 rc = Parser_execarg(argc - 2, argv + 2, cmdlist);
00666 
00667         ret = do_disconnect(argv[0], 0);
00668         if (!rc)
00669                 rc = ret;
00670 
00671         return rc;
00672 }

00679 
00680 int jt_opt_threads(int argc, char **argv)
00681 {
00682         static char      cmdstr[128];
00683         sigset_t         saveset;
00684         sigset_t         sigset;
00685         struct sigaction sigact;
00686         struct sigaction saveact1;
00687         struct sigaction saveact2;
00688         unsigned long    threads;
00689         __u64            next_thread;
00690         int verbose;
00691         int rc = 0;
00692         int report_count = -1;
00693         char *end;
00694         int i;
00695 
00696         if (argc < 5)
00697                 return CMD_HELP;
00698 
00699         threads = strtoul(argv[1], &end, 0);
00700 
00701         if (*end == '.')
00702                 report_count = strtoul(end + 1, &end, 0);
00703 
00704         if (*end || threads > MAX_THREADS) {
00705                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid thread count '%s'\n",
00706                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[1]);
00707                 return CMD_HELP;
00708         }
00709 
00710         verbose = get_verbose(argv[0], argv[2]);
00711         if (verbose == BAD_VERBOSE)
00712                 return CMD_HELP;
00713 
00714         if (verbose != 0) {
00715                 snprintf(cmdstr, sizeof(cmdstr), "%s", argv[4]);
00716                 for (i = 5; i < argc; i++)
00717                         snprintf(cmdstr + strlen(cmdstr), sizeof(cmdstr),
00718                                  " %s", argv[i]);
00719 
00720                 printf("%s: starting %ld threads on device %s running %s\n",
00721                        argv[0], threads, argv[3], cmdstr);
00722         }
00723 
00724         shmem_reset(threads);
00725 
00726         sigemptyset(&sigset);
00727         sigaddset(&sigset, SIGALRM);
00728         sigaddset(&sigset, SIGCHLD);
00729         sigprocmask(SIG_BLOCK, &sigset, &saveset);
00730 
00731         nthreads = threads;
00732 
00733         for (i = 1, next_thread = verbose; i <= threads; i++) {
00734                 rc = fork();
00735                 if (rc < 0) {
00736                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: #%d - %s\n", argv[0], i,
00737                                 strerror(rc = errno));
00738                         break;
00739                 } else if (rc == 0) {
00740                         sigprocmask(SIG_SETMASK, &saveset, NULL);
00741 
00742                         thread = i;
00743                         argv[2] = "--device";
00744                         exit(jt_opt_device(argc - 2, argv + 2));
00745                 } else if (be_verbose(verbose, NULL, i, &next_thread, threads))
00746                         printf("%s: thread #%d (PID %d) started\n",
00747                                argv[0], i, rc);
00748                 rc = 0;
00749         }
00750 
00751         if (!thread) {          /* parent process */
00752                 int live_threads = threads;
00753 
00754                 sigemptyset(&sigset);
00755                 sigemptyset(&sigact.sa_mask);
00756                 sigact.sa_handler = parent_sighandler;
00757                 sigact.sa_flags = 0;
00758 
00759                 sigaction(SIGALRM, &sigact, &saveact1);
00760                 sigaction(SIGCHLD, &sigact, &saveact2);
00761 
00762                 while (live_threads > 0) {
00763                         int status;
00764                         pid_t ret;
00765 
00766                         if (verbose < 0)        /* periodic stats */
00767                                 alarm(-verbose);
00768 
00769                         sigsuspend(&sigset);
00770                         alarm(0);
00771 
00772                         while (live_threads > 0) {
00773                                 ret = waitpid(0, &status, WNOHANG);
00774                                 if (ret == 0)
00775                                         break;
00776 
00777                                 if (ret < 0) {
00778                                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: wait - %s\n",
00779                                                 argv[0], strerror(errno));
00780                                         if (!rc)
00781                                                 rc = errno;
00782                                         continue;
00783                                 } else {
00784                                         /*
00785                                          * This is a hack.  We _should_ be able
00786                                          * to use WIFEXITED(status) to see if
00787                                          * there was an error, but it appears
00788                                          * to be broken and it always returns 1
00789                                          * (OK).  See wait(2).
00790                                          */
00791                                         int err = WEXITSTATUS(status);
00792                                         if (err || WIFSIGNALED(status))
00793                                                 fprintf(stderr,
00794                                                         "%s: PID %d had rc=%d\n",
00795                                                         argv[0], ret, err);
00796                                         if (!rc)
00797                                                 rc = err;
00798 
00799                                         live_threads--;
00800                                 }
00801                         }
00802 
00803                         /* Show stats while all threads running */
00804                         if (verbose < 0) {
00805                                 shmem_snap(threads, live_threads);
00806                                 if (report_count > 0 && --report_count == 0)
00807                                         shmem_stop();
00808                         }
00809                 }
00810                 sigaction(SIGCHLD, &saveact2, NULL);
00811                 sigaction(SIGALRM, &saveact1, NULL);
00812         }
00813 
00814         shmem_total(threads);
00815         sigprocmask(SIG_SETMASK, &saveset, NULL);
00816 
00817         return rc;
00818 }
00819 #else
00820 int jt_opt_threads(int argc, char **argv)
00821 {
00822         fprintf(stderr, "%s not-supported in a single-threaded runtime\n",
00823                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
00824         return CMD_HELP;
00825 }
00826 #endif
00827 
00828 int jt_opt_net(int argc, char **argv)
00829 {
00830         char *arg2[3];
00831         int rc;
00832 
00833         if (argc < 3)
00834                 return CMD_HELP;
00835 
00836         arg2[0] = argv[0];
00837         arg2[1] = argv[1];
00838         arg2[2] = NULL;
00839         rc = jt_ptl_network (2, arg2);
00840 
00841         if (!rc)
00842                 rc = Parser_execarg(argc - 2, argv + 2, cmdlist);
00843 
00844         return rc;
00845 }
00846 
00847 int jt_obd_no_transno(int argc, char **argv)
00848 {
00849         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
00850         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
00851         int rc;
00852 
00853         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00854         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
00855 
00856         if (argc != 1)
00857                 return CMD_HELP;
00858 
00859         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
00860         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00861         if (rc) {
00862                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
00863                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
00864                 return rc;
00865         }
00866         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_NO_TRANSNO, buf);
00867         if (rc < 0)
00868                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00869                         strerror(rc = errno));
00870 
00871         return rc;
00872 }

00927 
00928 int jt_get_version(int argc, char **argv)
00929 {
00930         int rc;
00931         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN];
00932         char *version;
00933 
00934         if (argc != 1)
00935                 return CMD_HELP;
00936 
00937         rc = llapi_get_version(rawbuf, MAX_IOC_BUFLEN, &version);
00938         if (rc)
00939                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
00940                         strerror(-rc));
00941         else
00942                 printf("Lustre version: %s\n", version);
00943 
00944         return rc;
00945 }
00946 
00947 static void print_obd_line(char *s)
00948 {
00949         const char *param = "osc/%s/ost_conn_uuid";
00950         char buf[MAX_STRING_SIZE];
00951         char obd_name[MAX_OBD_NAME];
00952         FILE *fp = NULL;
00953         glob_t path;
00954         char *ptr;
00955 retry:
00956         /* obd device type is the first 3 characters of param name */
00957         snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), " %%*d %%*s %.3s %%%zus %%*s %%*d ",
00958                  param, sizeof(obd_name) - 1);
00959         if (sscanf(s, buf, obd_name) == 0)
00960                 goto try_mdc;
00961         if (cfs_get_param_paths(&path, param, obd_name) != 0)
00962                 goto try_mdc;
00963         fp = fopen(path.gl_pathv[0], "r");
00964         if (fp == NULL) {
00965                 /* need to free path data before retry */
00966                 cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00967 try_mdc:
00968                 if (param[0] == 'o') { /* failed with osc, try mdc */
00969                         param = "mdc/%s/mds_conn_uuid";
00970                         goto retry;
00971                 }
00972                 buf[0] = '\0';
00973                 goto fail_print;
00974         }
00975 
00976         /* should not ignore fgets(3)'s return value */
00977         if (!fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), fp)) {
00978                 fprintf(stderr, "reading from %s: %s", buf, strerror(errno));
00979                 goto fail_close;
00980         }
00981 
00982 fail_close:
00983         fclose(fp);
00984         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00985 
00986         /* trim trailing newlines */
00987         ptr = strrchr(buf, '\n');
00988         if (ptr)
00989                 *ptr = '\0';
00990 fail_print:
00991         ptr = strrchr(s, '\n');
00992         if (ptr)
00993                 *ptr = '\0';
00994         printf("%s%s%s\n", s, buf[0] ? " " : "", buf);
00995 }
00996 
00997 /* get device list by ioctl */
00998 int jt_obd_list_ioctl(int argc, char **argv)
00999 {
01000         int rc, index;
01001         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
01002         struct obd_ioctl_data *data = (struct obd_ioctl_data *)buf;
01003 
01004         if (argc > 2)
01005                 return CMD_HELP;
01006         /* Just ignore a -t option.  Only supported with /proc. */
01007         else if (argc == 2 && strcmp(argv[1], "-t") != 0)
01008                 return CMD_HELP;
01009 
01010         for (index = 0;; index++) {
01011                 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
01012                 data->ioc_version = OBD_IOCTL_VERSION;
01013                 data->ioc_inllen1 =
01014                         sizeof(rawbuf) - cfs_size_round(sizeof(*data));
01015                 data->ioc_inlbuf1 = buf + cfs_size_round(sizeof(*data));
01016                 data->ioc_len = obd_ioctl_packlen(data);
01017                 data->ioc_count = index;
01018 
01019                 rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_GETDEVICE, buf);
01020                 if (rc != 0)
01021                         break;
01022                 printf("%s\n", (char *)data->ioc_bulk);
01023         }
01024         if (rc != 0) {
01025                 if (errno == ENOENT)
01026                         /* no device or the last device */
01027                         rc = 0;
01028                 else
01029                         fprintf(stderr, "Error getting device list: %s: "
01030                                 "check dmesg.\n", strerror(errno));
01031         }
01032         return rc;
01033 }
01034 
01035 int jt_obd_list(int argc, char **argv)
01036 {
01037         char buf[MAX_STRING_SIZE];
01038         int print_obd = 0;
01039         glob_t path;
01040         FILE *fp;
01041 
01042         if (argc > 2)
01043                 return CMD_HELP;
01044         else if (argc == 2) {
01045                 if (strcmp(argv[1], "-t") == 0)
01046                         print_obd = 1;
01047                 else
01048                         return CMD_HELP;
01049         }
01050 
01051         if (cfs_get_param_paths(&path, "devices") != 0)
01052                 return -errno;
01053 
01054         fp = fopen(path.gl_pathv[0], "r");
01055         if (fp == NULL) {
01056                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s opening %s\n",
01057                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(errno), path.gl_pathv[0]);
01058                 cfs_free_param_data(&path);
01059                 return jt_obd_list_ioctl(argc, argv);
01060         }
01061 
01062         while (fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), fp) != NULL)
01063                 if (print_obd)
01064                         print_obd_line(buf);
01065                 else
01066                         printf("%s", buf);
01067 
01068         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
01069         fclose(fp);
01070         return 0;
01071 }
01072 
01073 struct jt_fid_space {
01074         __u64   jt_seq;
01075         __u64   jt_id;
01076         int     jt_width;
01077 };
01078 
01079 int jt_obd_alloc_fids(struct jt_fid_space *space, struct lu_fid *fid,
01080                       __u64 *count)
01081 {
01082         int rc;
01083 
01084         if (space->jt_seq == 0 || space->jt_id == space->jt_width) {
01085                 struct obd_ioctl_data  data;
01086                 char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN];
01087                 char *buf = rawbuf;
01088                 __u64 seqnr;
01089                 int max_count;
01090 
01091                 memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
01092                 data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
01093 
01094                 data.ioc_pbuf1 = (char *)&seqnr;
01095                 data.ioc_plen1 = sizeof(seqnr);
01096 
01097                 data.ioc_pbuf2 = (char *)&max_count;
01098                 data.ioc_plen2 = sizeof(max_count);
01099 
01100                 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
01101                 rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01102                 if (rc) {
01103                         fprintf(stderr, "error: invalid ioctl rc = %d\n", rc);
01104                         return rc;
01105                 }
01106 
01107                 rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_ECHO_ALLOC_SEQ, buf);
01108                 if (rc) {
01109                         fprintf(stderr, "ioctl error: rc = %d\n", rc);
01110                         return rc;
01111                 }
01112 
01113                 space->jt_seq = *(__u64 *)data.ioc_pbuf1;
01114                 space->jt_width = *(int *)data.ioc_pbuf2;
01115                 space->jt_id = 1;
01116         }
01117         fid->f_seq = space->jt_seq;
01118         fid->f_oid = space->jt_id;
01119         fid->f_ver = 0;
01120 
01121         space->jt_id = space->jt_id + *count;
01122         if (space->jt_id > space->jt_width)
01123                 space->jt_id = space->jt_width;
01124 
01125         *count = space->jt_id - fid->f_oid;
01126         return 0;
01127 }
01128 
01129 #define MD_STEP_COUNT 1000
01130 int jt_obd_md_common(int argc, char **argv, int cmd)
01131 {
01132         struct obd_ioctl_data  data;
01133         struct timeval         start;
01134         struct timeval         end_time;
01135         char                   rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN];
01136         char                  *buf = rawbuf;
01137         int                    mode = 0000644;
01138         int                    create_mode;
01139         int                    rc = 0;
01140         char                  *parent_basedir = NULL;
01141         char                   dirname[4096];
01142         int                    parent_base_id = 0;
01143         int                    parent_count = 1;
01144         __u64                  child_base_id = -1;
01145         int                    stripe_count = 0;
01146         int                    stripe_index = -1;
01147         int                    count = 0;
01148         char                  *end;
01149         __u64                  seconds = 0;
01150         double                 diff;
01151         int                    c;
01152         __u64                  total_count = 0;
01153         char                  *name = NULL;
01154         struct jt_fid_space    fid_space = {0};
01155         int                    version = 0;
01156         struct option          long_opts[] = {
01157                 {"child_base_id",     required_argument, 0, 'b'},
01158                 {"stripe_count",      required_argument, 0, 'c'},
01159                 {"parent_basedir",    required_argument, 0, 'd'},
01160                 {"parent_dircount",   required_argument, 0, 'D'},
01161                 {"stripe_index",      required_argument, 0, 'i'},
01162                 {"mode",              required_argument, 0, 'm'},
01163                 {"count",             required_argument, 0, 'n'},
01164                 {"time",              required_argument, 0, 't'},
01165                 {"version",           no_argument,       0, 'v'},
01166                 {0, 0, 0, 0}
01167         };
01168 
01169         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "b:c:d:D:m:n:t:v",
01170                                 long_opts, NULL)) >= 0) {
01171                 switch (c) {
01172                 case 'b':
01173                         child_base_id = strtoull(optarg, &end, 0);
01174                         if (*end) {
01175                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad child_base_id"
01176                                         " '%s'\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]), optarg);
01177                                 return CMD_HELP;
01178                         }
01179                         break;
01180                 case 'c':
01181                         stripe_count = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
01182                         if (*end) {
01183                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad stripe count"
01184                                         " '%s'\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]), optarg);
01185                                 return CMD_HELP;
01186                         }
01187                         break;
01188                 case 'd':
01189                         parent_basedir = optarg;
01190                         break;
01191                 case 'D':
01192                         parent_count = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
01193                         if (*end) {
01194                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad parent count"
01195                                         " '%s'\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]), optarg);
01196                                 return CMD_HELP;
01197                         }
01198                         break;
01199                 case 'i':
01200                         stripe_index = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
01201                         if (*end) {
01202                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad stripe index"
01203                                         " '%s'\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]), optarg);
01204                                 return CMD_HELP;
01205                         }
01206                         break;
01207                 case 'm':
01208                         mode = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
01209                         if (*end) {
01210                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad mode '%s'\n",
01211                                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), optarg);
01212                                 return CMD_HELP;
01213                         }
01214                         break;
01215                 case 'n':
01216                         total_count = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
01217                         if (*end || total_count == 0) {
01218                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad child count '%s'\n",
01219                                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), optarg);
01220                                 return CMD_HELP;
01221                         }
01222                         break;
01223                 case 't':
01224                         seconds = strtoull(optarg, &end, 0);
01225                         if (*end) {
01226                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: seconds '%s'\n",
01227                                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), optarg);
01228                                 return CMD_HELP;
01229                         }
01230                         break;
01231                 case 'v':
01232                         version = 1;
01233                         break;
01234                 default:
01235                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: option '%s' "
01236                                 "unrecognized\n", argv[0], argv[optind - 1]);
01237                         return CMD_HELP;
01238                 }
01239         }
01240 
01241         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
01242         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
01243         if (child_base_id == -1) {
01244                 if (optind >= argc)
01245                         return CMD_HELP;
01246                 name = argv[optind];
01247                 total_count = 1;
01248         } else {
01249                 if (optind < argc) {
01250                         fprintf(stderr, "child_base_id and name can not"
01251                                         " specified at the same time\n");
01252                         return CMD_HELP;
01253                 }
01254         }
01255 
01256         if (stripe_count == 0 && stripe_index != -1) {
01257                 fprintf(stderr, "If stripe_count is 0, stripe_index can not"
01258                                 "be specified\n");
01259                 return CMD_HELP;
01260         }
01261 
01262         if (total_count == 0 && seconds == 0) {
01263                 fprintf(stderr, "count or seconds needs to be indicated\n");
01264                 return CMD_HELP;
01265         }
01266 
01267         if (parent_count <= 0) {
01268                 fprintf(stderr, "parent count must < 0\n");
01269                 return CMD_HELP;
01270         }
01271 
01272 #ifdef MAX_THREADS
01273         if (thread) {
01274                 shmem_lock();
01275                 /* threads interleave */
01276                 if (parent_base_id != -1)
01277                         parent_base_id += (thread - 1) % parent_count;
01278 
01279                 if (child_base_id != -1)
01280                         child_base_id +=  (thread - 1) * \
01281                                           (MAX_BASE_ID / nthreads);
01282 
01283                 shmem_start_time_locked();
01284                 shmem_unlock();
01285         }
01286 #endif
01287         /* If parent directory is not specified, try to get the directory
01288          * from name */
01289         if (parent_basedir == NULL) {
01290                 char *last_lash;
01291                 if (name == NULL) {
01292                         fprintf(stderr, "parent_basedir or name must be"
01293                                         "indicated!\n");
01294                         return CMD_HELP;
01295                 }
01296                 /*Get directory and name from name*/
01297                 last_lash = strrchr(name, '/');
01298                 if (last_lash == NULL || name[0] != '/') {
01299                         fprintf(stderr, "Can not locate %s\n", name);
01300                         return CMD_HELP;
01301                 }
01302 
01303                 if (last_lash == name) {
01304                         sprintf(dirname, "%s", "/");
01305                         name++;
01306                 } else {
01307                         int namelen = (unsigned long)last_lash -
01308                                       (unsigned long)name + 1;
01309                         snprintf(dirname, namelen, "%s", name);
01310                         name = last_lash + 1;
01311                 }
01312 
01313                 data.ioc_pbuf1 = dirname;
01314                 data.ioc_plen1 = strlen(dirname);
01315 
01316                 data.ioc_pbuf2 = name;
01317                 data.ioc_plen2 = strlen(name);
01318         } else {
01319                 if (name != NULL) {
01320                         data.ioc_pbuf2 = name;
01321                         data.ioc_plen2 = strlen(name);
01322                 }
01323                 if (parent_base_id > 0)
01324                         sprintf(dirname, "%s%d", parent_basedir,
01325                                 parent_base_id);
01326                 else
01327                         sprintf(dirname, "%s", parent_basedir);
01328                 data.ioc_pbuf1 = dirname;
01329                 data.ioc_plen1 = strlen(dirname);
01330         }
01331 
01332         if (cmd == ECHO_MD_MKDIR || cmd == ECHO_MD_RMDIR)
01333                 create_mode = S_IFDIR;
01334         else
01335                 create_mode = S_IFREG;
01336 
01337         data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode = mode | S_IFDIR;
01338         data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLID | OBD_MD_FLTYPE | OBD_MD_FLMODE |
01339                                  OBD_MD_FLFLAGS | OBD_MD_FLGROUP;
01340         data.ioc_command = cmd;
01341 
01342         gettimeofday(&start, NULL);
01343         while (shmem_running()) {
01344                 struct lu_fid fid = { 0 };
01345 
01346                 if (child_base_id != -1)
01347                         data.ioc_obdo2.o_oi.oi.oi_id = child_base_id;
01348                 data.ioc_obdo2.o_mode = mode | create_mode;
01349                 data.ioc_obdo2.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLID | OBD_MD_FLTYPE |
01350                                          OBD_MD_FLMODE | OBD_MD_FLFLAGS |
01351                                          OBD_MD_FLGROUP;
01352                 data.ioc_obdo2.o_misc = stripe_count;
01353                 data.ioc_obdo2.o_stripe_idx = stripe_index;
01354 
01355                 if (total_count > 0) {
01356                         if ((total_count - count) > MD_STEP_COUNT)
01357                                 data.ioc_count = MD_STEP_COUNT;
01358                         else
01359                                 data.ioc_count = total_count - count;
01360                 } else {
01361                         data.ioc_count = MD_STEP_COUNT;
01362                 }
01363 
01364                 if (cmd == ECHO_MD_CREATE || cmd == ECHO_MD_MKDIR) {
01365                         /*Allocate fids for the create */
01366                         rc = jt_obd_alloc_fids(&fid_space, &fid,
01367                                                &data.ioc_count);
01368                         if (rc) {
01369                                 fprintf(stderr, "Allocate fids error %d.\n",rc);
01370                                 return rc;
01371                         }
01372                         fid_to_ostid(&fid, &data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi);
01373                 }
01374 
01375                 child_base_id += data.ioc_count;
01376                 count += data.ioc_count;
01377 
01378                 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
01379                 rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01380                 if (rc) {
01381                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl %d\n",
01382                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), rc);
01383                         return rc;
01384                 }
01385 
01386                 rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_ECHO_MD, buf);
01387                 if (rc) {
01388                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n",
01389                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(rc = errno));
01390                         return rc;
01391                 }
01392                 shmem_bump(data.ioc_count);
01393 
01394                 gettimeofday(&end_time, NULL);
01395                 diff = difftime(&end_time, &start);
01396                 if (seconds > 0 && (__u64)diff > seconds)
01397                         break;
01398 
01399                 if (count >= total_count && total_count > 0)
01400                         break;
01401         }
01402 
01403         if (count > 0 && version) {
01404                 gettimeofday(&end_time, NULL);
01405                 diff = difftime(&end_time, &start);
01406                 printf("%s: %d in %.3fs (%.3f /s): %s",
01407                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), count, diff,
01408                         (double)count/diff, ctime(&end_time.tv_sec));
01409         }
01410 
01411 #ifdef MAX_THREADS
01412         if (thread) {
01413                 shmem_lock();
01414                 shmem_end_time_locked();
01415                 shmem_unlock();
01416         }
01417 #endif
01418         return rc;
01419 }
01420

01422 {
01423         return jt_obd_md_common(argc, argv, ECHO_MD_CREATE);
01424 }
