01455 
01456 int jt_obd_create(int argc, char **argv)
01457 {
01458         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
01459         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
01460         struct timeval next_time;
01461         __u64 count = 1, next_count, base_id = 1;
01462         int verbose = 1, mode = 0100644, rc = 0, i;
01463         char *end;
01464 
01465         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
01466         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
01467         if (argc < 2 || argc > 4)
01468                 return CMD_HELP;
01469 
01470         count = strtoull(argv[1], &end, 0);
01471         if (*end) {
01472                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid iteration count '%s'\n",
01473                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[1]);
01474                 return CMD_HELP;
01475         }
01476 
01477         if (argc > 2) {
01478                 mode = strtoul(argv[2], &end, 0);
01479                 if (*end) {
01480                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid mode '%s'\n",
01481                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[2]);
01482                         return CMD_HELP;
01483                 }
01484                 if (!(mode & S_IFMT))
01485                         mode |= S_IFREG;
01486         }
01487 
01488         if (argc > 3) {
01489                 verbose = get_verbose(argv[0], argv[3]);
01490                 if (verbose == BAD_VERBOSE)
01491                         return CMD_HELP;
01492         }
01493 
01494         printf("%s: %jd objects\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t)count);
01495         gettimeofday(&next_time, NULL);
01496         next_time.tv_sec -= verbose;
01497 
01498         ostid_set_seq_echo(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi);
01499         for (i = 1, next_count = verbose; i <= count && shmem_running(); i++) {
01500                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode = mode;
01501                 ostid_set_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi, base_id);
01502                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_uid = 0;
01503                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_gid = 0;
01504                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLTYPE | OBD_MD_FLMODE |
01505                                          OBD_MD_FLID | OBD_MD_FLUID |
01506                                          OBD_MD_FLGID | OBD_MD_FLGROUP;
01507 
01508                 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
01509                 rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01510                 if (rc) {
01511                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
01512                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
01513                         return rc;
01514                 }
01515                 rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_CREATE, buf);
01516                 obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01517                 shmem_bump(1);
01518                 if (rc < 0) {
01519                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: #%d - %s\n",
01520                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), i, strerror(rc = errno));
01521                         break;
01522                 }
01523                 if (!(data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLID)) {
01524                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: oid not valid #%d:%#jx\n",
01525                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), i,
01526                                 (uintmax_t)data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid);
01527                         rc = EINVAL;
01528                         break;
01529                 }
01530 
01531                 if (be_verbose(verbose, &next_time, i, &next_count, count))
01532                         printf("%s: #%d is object id %#jx\n",
01533                                jt_cmdname(argv[0]), i,
01534                                (uintmax_t) ostid_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi));
01535         }
01536         return rc;
01537 }
01538 
01539 int jt_obd_setattr(int argc, char **argv)
01540 {
01541         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
01542         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
01543         char *end;
01544         int rc;
01545 
01546         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
01547         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
01548         if (argc != 2)
01549                 return CMD_HELP;
01550 
01551         ostid_set_seq_echo(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi);
01552         ostid_set_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi, strtoull(argv[1], &end, 0));
01553         if (*end) {
01554                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid objid '%s'\n",
01555                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[1]);
01556                 return CMD_HELP;
01557         }
01558         data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode = S_IFREG | strtoul(argv[2], &end, 0);
01559         if (*end) {
01560                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid mode '%s'\n",
01561                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[2]);
01562                 return CMD_HELP;
01563         }
01564         data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLID | OBD_MD_FLTYPE | OBD_MD_FLMODE;
01565 
01566         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
01567         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01568         if (rc) {
01569                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
01570                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
01571                 return rc;
01572         }
01573         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_SETATTR, buf);
01574         if (rc < 0)
01575                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
01576                         strerror(rc = errno));
01577 
01578         return rc;
01579 }
01580 
01581 int jt_obd_test_setattr(int argc, char **argv)
01582 {
01583         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
01584         struct timeval start, next_time;
01585         __u64 i, count, next_count;
01586         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
01587         int verbose = 1;
01588         __u64 objid = 3;
01589         char *end;
01590         int rc = 0;
01591 
01592         if (argc < 2 || argc > 4)
01593                 return CMD_HELP;
01594 
01595         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
01596         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
01597         count = strtoull(argv[1], &end, 0);
01598         if (*end) {
01599                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid iteration count '%s'\n",
01600                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[1]);
01601                 return CMD_HELP;
01602         }
01603 
01604         if (argc >= 3) {
01605                 verbose = get_verbose(argv[0], argv[2]);
01606                 if (verbose == BAD_VERBOSE)
01607                         return CMD_HELP;
01608         }
01609 
01610         if (argc >= 4) {
01611                 if (argv[3][0] == 't') {
01612                         objid = strtoull(argv[3] + 1, &end, 0);
01613                         if (thread)
01614                                 objid += thread - 1;
01615                 } else
01616                         objid = strtoull(argv[3], &end, 0);
01617                 if (*end) {
01618                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid objid '%s'\n",
01619                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[3]);
01620                         return CMD_HELP;
01621                 }
01622         }
01623 
01624         gettimeofday(&start, NULL);
01625         next_time.tv_sec = start.tv_sec - verbose;
01626         next_time.tv_usec = start.tv_usec;
01627         if (verbose != 0)
01628                 printf("%s: setting %jd attrs (objid %#jx): %s",
01629                        jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t)count,
01630                        (uintmax_t)objid, ctime(&start.tv_sec));
01631 
01632         ostid_set_seq_echo(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi);
01633         for (i = 1, next_count = verbose; i <= count && shmem_running(); i++) {
01634                 ostid_set_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi, objid);
01635                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode = S_IFREG;
01636                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLID | OBD_MD_FLTYPE | OBD_MD_FLMODE;
01637                 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
01638                 rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01639                 if (rc) {
01640                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
01641                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
01642                         return rc;
01643                 }
01644                 rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_SETATTR, &data);
01645                 shmem_bump(1);
01646                 if (rc < 0) {
01647                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: #%jd - %d:%s\n",
01648                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t)i,
01649                                 errno, strerror(rc = errno));
01650                         break;
01651                 } else {
01652                         if (be_verbose
01653                             (verbose, &next_time, i, &next_count, count))
01654                                 printf("%s: set attr #%jd\n",
01655                                        jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t)i);
01656                 }
01657         }
01658 
01659         if (!rc) {
01660                 struct timeval end;
01661                 double diff;
01662 
01663                 gettimeofday(&end, NULL);
01664 
01665                 diff = difftime(&end, &start);
01666 
01667                 --i;
01668                 if (verbose != 0)
01669                         printf("%s: %jd attrs in %.3fs (%.3f attr/s): %s",
01670                                jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t)i, diff,
01671                                i / diff, ctime(&end.tv_sec));
01672         }
01673         return rc;
01674 }
01675 
01676 int jt_obd_destroy(int argc, char **argv)
01677 {
01678         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
01679         struct timeval next_time;
01680         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
01681         __u64 count = 1, next_count;
01682         int verbose = 1;
01683         __u64 id;
01684         char *end;
01685         int rc = 0, i;
01686 
01687         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
01688         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
01689         if (argc < 2 || argc > 4)
01690                 return CMD_HELP;
01691 
01692         id = strtoull(argv[1], &end, 0);
01693         if (*end || id == 0 || errno != 0) {
01694                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid objid '%s'\n",
01695                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[1]);
01696                 return CMD_HELP;
01697         }
01698         if (argc > 2) {
01699                 count = strtoull(argv[2], &end, 0);
01700                 if (*end) {
01701                         fprintf(stderr,
01702                                 "error: %s: invalid iteration count '%s'\n",
01703                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[2]);
01704                         return CMD_HELP;
01705                 }
01706         }
01707 
01708         if (argc > 3) {
01709                 verbose = get_verbose(argv[0], argv[3]);
01710                 if (verbose == BAD_VERBOSE)
01711                         return CMD_HELP;
01712         }
01713 
01714         printf("%s: %jd objects\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t)count);
01715         gettimeofday(&next_time, NULL);
01716         next_time.tv_sec -= verbose;
01717 
01718         ostid_set_seq_echo(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi);
01719         for (i = 1, next_count = verbose; i <= count && shmem_running(); i++, id++) {
01720                 ostid_set_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi, id);
01721                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode = S_IFREG | 0644;
01722                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLID | OBD_MD_FLMODE;
01723 
01724                 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
01725                 rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01726                 if (rc) {
01727                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
01728                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
01729                         return rc;
01730                 }
01731                 rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_DESTROY, buf);
01732                 obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01733                 shmem_bump(1);
01734                 if (rc < 0) {
01735                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: objid %#jx: %s\n",
01736                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t)id,
01737                                 strerror(rc = errno));
01738                         break;
01739                 }
01740 
01741                 if (be_verbose(verbose, &next_time, i, &next_count, count))
01742                         printf("%s: #%d is object id %#jx\n",
01743                                jt_cmdname(argv[0]), i, (uintmax_t)id);
01744         }
01745 
01746         return rc;
01747 }
01748 
01749 int jt_obd_getattr(int argc, char **argv)
01750 {
01751         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
01752         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
01753         char *end;
01754         int rc;
01755 
01756         if (argc != 2)
01757                 return CMD_HELP;
01758 
01759         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
01760         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
01761         ostid_set_seq_echo(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi);
01762         ostid_set_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi, strtoull(argv[1], &end, 0));
01763         if (*end) {
01764                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid objid '%s'\n",
01765                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[1]);
01766                 return CMD_HELP;
01767         }
01768         /* to help obd filter */
01769         data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode = 0100644;
01770         data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid = 0xffffffff;
01771         printf("%s: object id %#jx\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
01772                (uintmax_t)ostid_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi));
01773 
01774         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
01775         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01776         if (rc) {
01777                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
01778                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
01779                 return rc;
01780         }
01781         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_GETATTR, buf);
01782         obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01783         if (rc) {
01784                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
01785                         strerror(rc = errno));
01786         } else {
01787                 printf("%s: object id %ju, mode %o\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
01788                        (uintmax_t)ostid_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi),
01789                        data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode);
01790         }
01791         return rc;
01792 }
01793 
01794 int jt_obd_test_getattr(int argc, char **argv)
01795 {
01796         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
01797         struct timeval start, next_time;
01798         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
01799         __u64 i, count, next_count;
01800         int verbose = 1;
01801         __u64 objid = 3;
01802         char *end;
01803         int rc = 0;
01804 
01805         if (argc < 2 || argc > 4)
01806                 return CMD_HELP;
01807 
01808         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
01809         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
01810         count = strtoull(argv[1], &end, 0);
01811         if (*end) {
01812                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid iteration count '%s'\n",
01813                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[1]);
01814                 return CMD_HELP;
01815         }
01816 
01817         if (argc >= 3) {
01818                 verbose = get_verbose(argv[0], argv[2]);
01819                 if (verbose == BAD_VERBOSE)
01820                         return CMD_HELP;
01821         }
01822 
01823         if (argc >= 4) {
01824                 if (argv[3][0] == 't') {
01825                         objid = strtoull(argv[3] + 1, &end, 0);
01826                         if (thread)
01827                                 objid += thread - 1;
01828                 } else
01829                         objid = strtoull(argv[3], &end, 0);
01830                 if (*end) {
01831                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid objid '%s'\n",
01832                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[3]);
01833                         return CMD_HELP;
01834                 }
01835         }
01836 
01837         gettimeofday(&start, NULL);
01838         next_time.tv_sec = start.tv_sec - verbose;
01839         next_time.tv_usec = start.tv_usec;
01840         if (verbose != 0)
01841                 printf("%s: getting %jd attrs (objid %#jx): %s",
01842                        jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t) count,
01843                        (uintmax_t)objid, ctime(&start.tv_sec));
01844 
01845         ostid_set_seq_echo(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi);
01846         for (i = 1, next_count = verbose; i <= count && shmem_running(); i++) {
01847                 ostid_set_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi, objid);
01848                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode = S_IFREG;
01849                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid = 0xffffffff;
01850                 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
01851                 rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
01852                 if (rc) {
01853                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
01854                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
01855                         return rc;
01856                 }
01857                 rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_GETATTR, &data);
01858                 shmem_bump(1);
01859                 if (rc < 0) {
01860                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: #%jd - %d:%s\n",
01861                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t)i,
01862                                 errno, strerror(rc = errno));
01863                         break;
01864                 } else {
01865                         if (be_verbose
01866                             (verbose, &next_time, i, &next_count, count))
01867                                 printf("%s: got attr #%jd\n",
01868                                        jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t)i);
01869                 }
01870         }
01871 
01872         if (!rc) {
01873                 struct timeval end;
01874                 double diff;
01875 
01876                 gettimeofday(&end, NULL);
01877 
01878                 diff = difftime(&end, &start);
01879 
01880                 --i;
01881                 if (verbose != 0)
01882                         printf("%s: %jd attrs in %.3fs (%.3f attr/s): %s",
01883                                jt_cmdname(argv[0]), (uintmax_t) i, diff,
01884                                i / diff, ctime(&end.tv_sec));
01885         }
01886         return rc;
01887 }
01888 
01889 /* test_brw <cnt>                                               count
01890         <r|w[r(repeat)x(noverify)]>                             mode
01891         <q|v|#(print interval)>                                 verbosity
01892         <npages[+offset]>                                       blocksize
01893         <[[<interleave_threads>]t(inc obj by thread#)]obj>      object
01894         [p|g<args>]                                             batch */
01895 int jt_obd_test_brw(int argc, char **argv)
01896 {
01897         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
01898         struct timeval start, next_time;
01899         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
01900         __u64 count, next_count, len, stride, thr_offset = 0, objid = 3;
01901         int write = 0, verbose = 1, cmd, i, rc = 0, pages = 1;
01902         int offset_pages = 0;
01903         long n;
01904         int repeat_offset = 0;
01905         unsigned long long ull;
01906         int  nthr_per_obj = 0;
01907         int  verify = 1;
01908         int  obj_idx = 0;
01909         char *end;
01910 
01911         if (argc < 2 || argc > 7) {
01912                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad number of arguments: %d\n",
01913                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argc);
01914                 return CMD_HELP;
01915         }
01916 
01917         count = strtoull(argv[1], &end, 0);
01918         if (*end) {
01919                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad iteration count '%s'\n",
01920                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[1]);
01921                 return CMD_HELP;
01922         }
01923 
01924         if (argc >= 3) {
01925                 if (argv[2][0] == 'w' || argv[2][0] == '1')
01926                         write = 1;
01927                 /* else it's a read */
01928 
01929                 if (argv[2][0] != 0)
01930                         for (i = 1; argv[2][i] != 0; i++)
01931                                 switch (argv[2][i]) {
01932                                 case 'r':
01933                                         repeat_offset = 1;
01934                                         break;
01935 
01936                                 case 'x':
01937                                         verify = 0;
01938                                         break;
01939 
01940                                 default:
01941                                         fprintf (stderr, "Can't parse cmd '%s'\n",
01942                                                  argv[2]);
01943                                         return CMD_HELP;
01944                                 }
01945         }
01946 
01947         if (argc >= 4) {
01948                 verbose = get_verbose(argv[0], argv[3]);
01949                 if (verbose == BAD_VERBOSE)
01950                         return CMD_HELP;
01951         }
01952 
01953         if (argc >= 5) {
01954                 pages = strtoul(argv[4], &end, 0);
01955 
01956                 if (*end == '+')
01957                         offset_pages = strtoul(end + 1, &end, 0);
01958 
01959                 if (*end != 0 ||
01960                     offset_pages < 0 || offset_pages >= pages) {
01961                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad npages[+offset] parameter '%s'\n",
01962                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[4]);
01963                         return CMD_HELP;
01964                 }
01965         }
01966 
01967         if (argc >= 6) {
01968                 if (thread &&
01969                     (n = strtol(argv[5], &end, 0)) > 0 &&
01970                     *end == 't' &&
01971                     (ull = strtoull(end + 1, &end, 0)) > 0 &&
01972                     *end == 0) {
01973                         nthr_per_obj = n;
01974                         objid = ull;
01975                 } else if (thread &&
01976                            argv[5][0] == 't') {
01977                         nthr_per_obj = 1;
01978                         objid = strtoull(argv[5] + 1, &end, 0);
01979                 } else {
01980                         nthr_per_obj = 0;
01981                         objid = strtoull(argv[5], &end, 0);
01982                 }
01983                 if (*end) {
01984                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad objid '%s'\n",
01985                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[5]);
01986                         return CMD_HELP;
01987                 }
01988         }
01989 
01990         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
01991         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
01992 
01993         /* communicate the 'type' of brw test and batching to echo_client.
01994          * don't start.  we'd love to refactor this lctl->echo_client
01995          * interface */
01996         data.ioc_pbuf1 = (void *)1;
01997         data.ioc_plen1 = 1;
01998 
01999         if (argc >= 7) {
02000                 switch(argv[6][0]) {
02001                         case 'g': /* plug and unplug */
02002                                 data.ioc_pbuf1 = (void *)2;
02003                                 data.ioc_plen1 = strtoull(argv[6] + 1, &end,
02004                                                           0);
02005                                 break;
02006                         case 'p': /* prep and commit */
02007                                 data.ioc_pbuf1 = (void *)3;
02008                                 data.ioc_plen1 = strtoull(argv[6] + 1, &end,
02009                                                           0);
02010                                 break;
02011                         default:
02012                                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: batching '%s' "
02013                                         "needs to specify 'p' or 'g'\n",
02014                                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[6]);
02015                                 return CMD_HELP;
02016                 }
02017 
02018                 if (*end) {
02019                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: bad batching '%s'\n",
02020                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), argv[6]);
02021                         return CMD_HELP;
02022                 }
02023                 data.ioc_plen1 *= getpagesize();
02024         }
02025 
02026         len = pages * getpagesize();
02027         thr_offset = offset_pages * getpagesize();
02028         stride = len;
02029 
02030 #ifdef MAX_THREADS
02031         if (thread) {
02032                 shmem_lock ();
02033                 if (nthr_per_obj != 0) {
02034                         /* threads interleave */
02035                         obj_idx = (thread - 1)/nthr_per_obj;
02036                         objid += obj_idx;
02037                         stride *= nthr_per_obj;
02038                         if ((thread - 1) % nthr_per_obj == 0) {
02039                                 shared_data->body.offsets[obj_idx] =
02040                                         stride + thr_offset;
02041                         }
02042                         thr_offset += ((thread - 1) % nthr_per_obj) * len;
02043                 } else {
02044                         /* threads disjoint */
02045                         thr_offset += (thread - 1) * len;
02046                 }
02047 
02048                 shmem_start_time_locked();
02049                 shmem_unlock ();
02050         }
02051 #endif
02052 
02053         ostid_set_seq_echo(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi);
02054         ostid_set_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi, objid);
02055         data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode = S_IFREG;
02056         data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid = OBD_MD_FLID | OBD_MD_FLTYPE | OBD_MD_FLMODE |
02057                                  OBD_MD_FLFLAGS | OBD_MD_FLGROUP;
02058         data.ioc_obdo1.o_flags = (verify ? OBD_FL_DEBUG_CHECK : 0);
02059         data.ioc_count = len;
02060         data.ioc_offset = (repeat_offset ? 0 : thr_offset);
02061 
02062         gettimeofday(&start, NULL);
02063         next_time.tv_sec = start.tv_sec - verbose;
02064         next_time.tv_usec = start.tv_usec;
02065 
02066         if (verbose != 0)
02067                 printf("%s: %s %jux%d pages (obj %#jx, off %ju): %s",
02068                        jt_cmdname(argv[0]), write ? "writing" : "reading",
02069                        (uintmax_t)count, pages, (uintmax_t) objid,
02070                        (uintmax_t)data.ioc_offset, ctime(&start.tv_sec));
02071 
02072         cmd = write ? OBD_IOC_BRW_WRITE : OBD_IOC_BRW_READ;
02073         for (i = 1, next_count = verbose; i <= count && shmem_running(); i++) {
02074                 data.ioc_obdo1.o_valid &= ~(OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS|OBD_MD_FLGRANT);
02075                 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02076                 rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02077                 if (rc) {
02078                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02079                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02080                         return rc;
02081                 }
02082                 rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, cmd, buf);
02083                 shmem_bump(1);
02084                 if (rc) {
02085                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: #%d - %s on %s\n",
02086                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]), i, strerror(rc = errno),
02087                                 write ? "write" : "read");
02088                         break;
02089                 } else if (be_verbose(verbose, &next_time,i, &next_count,count)) {
02090                         shmem_lock ();
02091                         printf("%s: %s number %d @ %jd:%ju for %d\n",
02092                                jt_cmdname(argv[0]), write ? "write" : "read", i,
02093                                (uintmax_t)ostid_id(&data.ioc_obdo1.o_oi),
02094                                (uintmax_t)data.ioc_offset,
02095                                (int)(pages * getpagesize()));
02096                         shmem_unlock ();
02097                 }
02098 
02099                 if (!repeat_offset) {
02100 #ifdef MAX_THREADS
02101                         if (stride == len) {
02102                                 data.ioc_offset += stride;
02103                         } else if (i < count) {
02104                                 shmem_lock ();
02105                                 data.ioc_offset =
02106                                         shared_data->body.offsets[obj_idx];
02107                                 shared_data->body.offsets[obj_idx] += len;
02108                                 shmem_unlock ();
02109                         }
02110 #else
02111                         data.ioc_offset += len;
02112                         obj_idx = 0; /* avoids an unused var warning */
02113 #endif
02114                 }
02115         }
02116 
02117         if (!rc) {
02118                 struct timeval end;
02119                 double diff;
02120 
02121                 gettimeofday(&end, NULL);
02122 
02123                 diff = difftime(&end, &start);
02124 
02125                 --i;
02126                 if (verbose != 0)
02127                         printf("%s: %s %dx%d pages in %.3fs (%.3f MB/s): %s",
02128                                jt_cmdname(argv[0]), write ? "wrote" : "read",
02129                                i, pages, diff,
02130                                ((double)i * pages * getpagesize()) /
02131                                (diff * 1048576.0),
02132                                ctime(&end.tv_sec));
02133         }
02134 
02135 #ifdef MAX_THREADS
02136         if (thread) {
02137                 shmem_lock();
02138                 shmem_end_time_locked();
02139                 shmem_unlock();
02140         }
02141 #endif
02142         return rc;
02143 }
02144 
02145 int jt_obd_lov_getconfig(int argc, char **argv)
02146 {
02147         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02148         struct lov_desc desc;
02149         struct obd_uuid *uuidarray;
02150         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02151         __u32 *obdgens;
02152         char *path;
02153         int rc, fd;
02154 
02155         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02156         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02157 
02158         if (argc != 2)
02159                 return CMD_HELP;
02160 
02161         path = argv[1];
02162         fd = open(path, O_RDONLY);
02163         if (fd < 0) {
02164                 fprintf(stderr, "open \"%s\" failed: %s\n", path,
02165                         strerror(errno));
02166                 return -errno;
02167         }
02168 
02169         memset(&desc, 0, sizeof(desc));
02170         obd_str2uuid(&desc.ld_uuid, argv[1]);
02171         desc.ld_tgt_count = ((OBD_MAX_IOCTL_BUFFER-sizeof(data)-sizeof(desc)) /
02172                              (sizeof(*uuidarray) + sizeof(*obdgens)));
02173 
02174 repeat:
02175         uuidarray = calloc(desc.ld_tgt_count, sizeof(*uuidarray));
02176         if (!uuidarray) {
02177                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: no memory for %d uuid's\n",
02178                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), desc.ld_tgt_count);
02179                 rc = -ENOMEM;
02180                 goto out;
02181         }
02182         obdgens = calloc(desc.ld_tgt_count, sizeof(*obdgens));
02183         if (!obdgens) {
02184                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: no memory for %d generation #'s\n",
02185                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), desc.ld_tgt_count);
02186                 rc = -ENOMEM;
02187                 goto out_uuidarray;
02188         }
02189 
02190         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02191         data.ioc_inllen1 = sizeof(desc);
02192         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = (char *)&desc;
02193         data.ioc_inllen2 = desc.ld_tgt_count * sizeof(*uuidarray);
02194         data.ioc_inlbuf2 = (char *)uuidarray;
02195         data.ioc_inllen3 = desc.ld_tgt_count * sizeof(*obdgens);
02196         data.ioc_inlbuf3 = (char *)obdgens;
02197 
02198         if (obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf))) {
02199                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02200                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02201                 rc = -EINVAL;
02202                 goto out_obdgens;
02203         }
02204         rc = ioctl(fd, OBD_IOC_LOV_GET_CONFIG, buf);
02205         if (rc == -ENOSPC) {
02206                 free(uuidarray);
02207                 free(obdgens);
02208                 goto repeat;
02209         } else if (rc) {
02210                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: ioctl error: %s\n",
02211                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(rc = errno));
02212         } else {
02213                 struct obd_uuid *uuidp;
02214                 __u32 *genp;
02215                 int i;
02216 
02217                 if (obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf))) {
02218                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid reply\n",
02219                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02220                         rc = -EINVAL;
02221                         goto out;
02222                 }
02223                 if (desc.ld_default_stripe_count == (__u32)-1)
02224                         printf("default_stripe_count: %d\n", -1);
02225                 else
02226                         printf("default_stripe_count: %u\n",
02227                                desc.ld_default_stripe_count);
02228                 printf("default_stripe_size: %ju\n",
02229                        (uintmax_t)desc.ld_default_stripe_size);
02230                 printf("default_stripe_offset: %ju\n",
02231                        (uintmax_t)desc.ld_default_stripe_offset);
02232                 printf("default_stripe_pattern: %u\n", desc.ld_pattern);
02233                 printf("obd_count: %u\n", desc.ld_tgt_count);
02234                 printf("OBDS:\tobdidx\t\tobdgen\t\t obduuid\n");
02235                 uuidp = uuidarray;
02236                 genp = obdgens;
02237                 for (i = 0; i < desc.ld_tgt_count; i++, uuidp++, genp++)
02238                         printf("\t%6u\t%14u\t\t %s\n", i, *genp, (char *)uuidp);
02239         }
02240 out_obdgens:
02241         free(obdgens);
02242 out_uuidarray:
02243         free(uuidarray);
02244 out:
02245         close(fd);
02246         return rc;
02247 }
02248 
02249 static int do_activate(int argc, char **argv, int flag)
02250 {
02251         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02252         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02253         int rc;
02254 
02255         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02256         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02257         if (argc != 1)
02258                 return CMD_HELP;
02259 
02260         /* reuse offset for 'active' */
02261         data.ioc_offset = flag;
02262 
02263         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02264         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02265         if (rc) {
02266                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02267                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02268                 return rc;
02269         }
02270         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, IOC_OSC_SET_ACTIVE, buf);
02271         if (rc)
02272                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: failed: %s\n",
02273                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(rc = errno));
02274 
02275         return rc;
02276 }
02277 
02295 int jt_replace_nids(int argc, char **argv)
02296 {
02297         int rc;
02298         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02299         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02300 
02301         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02302         data.ioc_dev = get_mgs_device();
02303         if (argc != 3)
02304                 return CMD_HELP;
02305 
02306         data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(argv[1]) + 1;
02307         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = argv[1];
02308 
02309         data.ioc_inllen2 = strlen(argv[2]) + 1;
02310         data.ioc_inlbuf2 = argv[2];
02311         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02312         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02313         if (rc) {
02314                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02315                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02316                 return rc;
02317         }
02318 
02319         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_REPLACE_NIDS, buf);
02320         if (rc < 0) {
02321                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
02322                         strerror(rc = errno));
02323         }
02324 
02325         return rc;
02326 }
02327 
02328 int jt_obd_deactivate(int argc, char **argv)
02329 {
02330         return do_activate(argc, argv, 0);
02331 }
02332 
02333 int jt_obd_activate(int argc, char **argv)
02334 {
02335         return do_activate(argc, argv, 1);
02336 }
02337 
02338 int jt_obd_recover(int argc, char **argv)
02339 {
02340         int rc;
02341         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02342         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02343 
02344         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02345         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02346         if (argc > 2)
02347                 return CMD_HELP;
02348 
02349         if (argc == 2) {
02350                 data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(argv[1]) + 1;
02351                 data.ioc_inlbuf1 = argv[1];
02352         }
02353 
02354         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02355         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02356         if (rc) {
02357                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02358                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02359                 return rc;
02360         }
02361         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_CLIENT_RECOVER, buf);
02362         if (rc < 0) {
02363                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
02364                         strerror(rc = errno));
02365         }
02366 
02367         return rc;
02368 }
02369 
02370 int jt_obd_mdc_lookup(int argc, char **argv)
02371 {
02372         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02373         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02374         char *parent, *child;
02375         int rc, fd, verbose = 1;
02376 
02377         if (argc < 3 || argc > 4)
02378                 return CMD_HELP;
02379 
02380         parent = argv[1];
02381         child = argv[2];
02382         if (argc == 4)
02383                 verbose = get_verbose(argv[0], argv[3]);
02384 
02385         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02386         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02387 
02388         data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(child) + 1;
02389         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = child;
02390 
02391         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02392         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02393         if (rc) {
02394                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02395                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02396                 return rc;
02397         }
02398 
02399         fd = open(parent, O_RDONLY);
02400         if (fd < 0) {
02401                 fprintf(stderr, "open \"%s\" failed: %s\n", parent,
02402                         strerror(errno));
02403                 return -1;
02404         }
02405 
02406         rc = ioctl(fd, IOC_MDC_LOOKUP, buf);
02407         if (rc < 0) {
02408                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: ioctl error: %s\n",
02409                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(rc = errno));
02410         }
02411         close(fd);
02412 
02413         if (verbose) {
02414                 rc = obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02415                 if (rc) {
02416                         fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid reply\n",
02417                                 jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02418                         return rc;
02419                 }
02420                 printf("%s: mode %o uid %d gid %d\n", child,
02421                        data.ioc_obdo1.o_mode, data.ioc_obdo1.o_uid,
02422                        data.ioc_obdo1.o_gid);
02423         }
02424 
02425         return rc;
02426 }
02427 
02428 int jt_llog_catlist(int argc, char **argv)
02429 {
02430         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02431         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02432         int rc;
02433 
02434         if (argc != 1)
02435                 return CMD_HELP;
02436 
02437         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02438         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02439         data.ioc_inllen1 = sizeof(rawbuf) - cfs_size_round(sizeof(data));
02440         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02441         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02442         if (rc) {
02443                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02444                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02445                 return rc;
02446         }
02447         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_CATLOGLIST, buf);
02448         if (rc == 0)
02449                 fprintf(stdout, "%s", ((struct obd_ioctl_data*)buf)->ioc_bulk);
02450         else
02451                 fprintf(stderr, "OBD_IOC_CATLOGLIST failed: %s\n",
02452                         strerror(errno));
02453 
02454         return rc;
02455 }
02456 
02457 int jt_llog_info(int argc, char **argv)
02458 {
02459         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02460         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02461         int rc;
02462 
02463         if (argc != 2)
02464                 return CMD_HELP;
02465 
02466         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02467         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02468         data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(argv[1]) + 1;
02469         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = argv[1];
02470         data.ioc_inllen2 = sizeof(rawbuf) - cfs_size_round(sizeof(data)) -
02471                 cfs_size_round(data.ioc_inllen1);
02472         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02473         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02474         if (rc) {
02475                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02476                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02477                 return rc;
02478         }
02479 
02480         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_LLOG_INFO, buf);
02481         if (rc == 0)
02482                 fprintf(stdout, "%s", ((struct obd_ioctl_data*)buf)->ioc_bulk);
02483         else
02484                 fprintf(stderr, "OBD_IOC_LLOG_INFO failed: %s\n",
02485                         strerror(errno));
02486 
02487         return rc;
02488 }
02489 
02490 int jt_llog_print(int argc, char **argv)
02491 {
02492         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02493         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02494         int rc;
02495 
02496         if (argc != 2 && argc != 4)
02497                 return CMD_HELP;
02498 
02499         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02500         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02501         data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(argv[1]) + 1;
02502         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = argv[1];
02503         if (argc == 4) {
02504                 data.ioc_inllen2 = strlen(argv[2]) + 1;
02505                 data.ioc_inlbuf2 = argv[2];
02506                 data.ioc_inllen3 = strlen(argv[3]) + 1;
02507                 data.ioc_inlbuf3 = argv[3];
02508         } else {
02509                 char from[2] = "1", to[3] = "-1";
02510                 data.ioc_inllen2 = strlen(from) + 1;
02511                 data.ioc_inlbuf2 = from;
02512                 data.ioc_inllen3 = strlen(to) + 1;
02513                 data.ioc_inlbuf3 = to;
02514         }
02515         data.ioc_inllen4 = sizeof(rawbuf) - cfs_size_round(sizeof(data)) -
02516                 cfs_size_round(data.ioc_inllen1) -
02517                 cfs_size_round(data.ioc_inllen2) -
02518                 cfs_size_round(data.ioc_inllen3);
02519         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02520         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02521         if (rc) {
02522                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02523                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02524                 return rc;
02525         }
02526 
02527         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_LLOG_PRINT, buf);
02528         if (rc == 0)
02529                 fprintf(stdout, "%s", ((struct obd_ioctl_data*)buf)->ioc_bulk);
02530         else
02531                 fprintf(stderr, "OBD_IOC_LLOG_PRINT failed: %s\n",
02532                         strerror(errno));
02533 
02534         return rc;
02535 }
02536 
02537 static int llog_cancel_parse_optional(int argc, char **argv,
02538                                       struct obd_ioctl_data *data)
02539 {
02540         int cOpt;
02541         const char *const short_options = "c:l:i:h";
02542         const struct option long_options[] = {
02543                 {"catalog", required_argument, NULL, 'c'},
02544                 {"log_id", required_argument, NULL, 'l'},
02545                 {"log_idx", required_argument, NULL, 'i'},
02546                 {"help", no_argument, NULL, 'h'},
02547                 {NULL, 0, NULL, 0}
02548         };
02549 
02550         /* sanity check */
02551         if (!data || argc <= 1) {
02552                 return -1;
02553         }
02554 
02555         /*now process command line arguments*/
02556         while ((cOpt = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_options,
02557                                         long_options, NULL)) != -1) {
02558                 switch (cOpt) {
02559                 case 'c':
02560                         data->ioc_inllen1 = strlen(optarg) + 1;
02561                         data->ioc_inlbuf1 = optarg;
02562                         break;
02563 
02564                 case 'l':
02565                         data->ioc_inllen2 = strlen(optarg) + 1;
02566                         data->ioc_inlbuf2 = optarg;
02567                         break;
02568 
02569                 case 'i':
02570                         data->ioc_inllen3 = strlen(optarg) + 1;
02571                         data->ioc_inlbuf3 = optarg;
02572                         break;
02573 
02574                 case 'h':
02575                 default:
02576                         return -1;
02577                 }
02578         }
02579 
02580         if ((data->ioc_inlbuf1 == NULL) || (data->ioc_inlbuf3 == NULL)) {
02581                 /* missing mandatory parameters */
02582                 return -1;
02583         }
02584 
02585         return 0;
02586 }
02587 
02588 int jt_llog_cancel(int argc, char **argv)
02589 {
02590         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02591         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02592         int rc, i;
02593 
02594         /* check that the arguments provided are either all
02595          * optional or all positional.  No mixing allowed
02596          *
02597          * if argc is 4 or 3 then check all arguments to ensure that none
02598          * of them start with a '-'.  If so then this is invalid.
02599          * Otherwise if arg is > 4 then assume that this is optional
02600          * arguments, and parse as such ignoring any thing that's not
02601          * optional.  The result is that user must use optional arguments
02602          * for all mandatory parameters.  Code will ignore all other args
02603          *
02604          * The positional arguments option should eventually be phased out.
02605          */
02606         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02607         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02608 
02609         if (argc == 3 || argc == 4) {
02610                 for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
02611                         if (argv[i][0] == '-')
02612                                 return CMD_HELP;
02613                 }
02614                 data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(argv[1]) + 1;
02615                 data.ioc_inlbuf1 = argv[1];
02616                 if (argc == 4) {
02617                         data.ioc_inllen2 = strlen(argv[2]) + 1;
02618                         data.ioc_inlbuf2 = argv[2];
02619                         data.ioc_inllen3 = strlen(argv[3]) + 1;
02620                         data.ioc_inlbuf3 = argv[3];
02621                 } else {
02622                         data.ioc_inllen3 = strlen(argv[2]) + 1;
02623                         data.ioc_inlbuf3 = argv[2];
02624                 }
02625         } else {
02626                 if (llog_cancel_parse_optional(argc, argv, &data) != 0)
02627                         return CMD_HELP;
02628         }
02629 
02630         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02631         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02632         if (rc) {
02633                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02634                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02635                 return rc;
02636         }
02637 
02638         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_LLOG_CANCEL, buf);
02639         if (rc == 0)
02640                 fprintf(stdout, "index %s was canceled.\n",
02641                         argc == 4 ? argv[3] : argv[2]);
02642         else
02643                 fprintf(stderr, "OBD_IOC_LLOG_CANCEL failed: %s\n",
02644                         strerror(errno));
02645 
02646         return rc;
02647 }
02648 
02649 int jt_llog_check(int argc, char **argv)
02650 {
02651         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02652         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02653         int rc;
02654 
02655         if (argc != 2 && argc != 4)
02656                 return CMD_HELP;
02657 
02658         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02659         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02660         data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(argv[1]) + 1;
02661         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = argv[1];
02662         if (argc == 4) {
02663                 data.ioc_inllen2 = strlen(argv[2]) + 1;
02664                 data.ioc_inlbuf2 = argv[2];
02665                 data.ioc_inllen3 = strlen(argv[3]) + 1;
02666                 data.ioc_inlbuf3 = argv[3];
02667         } else {
02668                 char from[2] = "1", to[3] = "-1";
02669                 data.ioc_inllen2 = strlen(from) + 1;
02670                 data.ioc_inlbuf2 = from;
02671                 data.ioc_inllen3 = strlen(to) + 1;
02672                 data.ioc_inlbuf3 = to;
02673         }
02674         data.ioc_inllen4 = sizeof(rawbuf) - cfs_size_round(sizeof(data)) -
02675                 cfs_size_round(data.ioc_inllen1) -
02676                 cfs_size_round(data.ioc_inllen2) -
02677                 cfs_size_round(data.ioc_inllen3);
02678         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02679         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02680         if (rc) {
02681                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02682                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02683                 return rc;
02684         }
02685 
02686         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_LLOG_CHECK, buf);
02687         if (rc == 0)
02688                 fprintf(stdout, "%s", ((struct obd_ioctl_data*)buf)->ioc_bulk);
02689         else
02690                 fprintf(stderr, "OBD_IOC_LLOG_CHECK failed: %s\n",
02691                         strerror(errno));
02692         return rc;
02693 }
02694 
02695 int jt_llog_remove(int argc, char **argv)
02696 {
02697         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
02698         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
02699         int rc;
02700 
02701         if (argc != 3 && argc != 2)
02702                 return CMD_HELP;
02703 
02704         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
02705         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
02706         data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(argv[1]) + 1;
02707         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = argv[1];
02708         if (argc == 3){
02709                 data.ioc_inllen2 = strlen(argv[2]) + 1;
02710                 data.ioc_inlbuf2 = argv[2];
02711         }
02712         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
02713         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
02714         if (rc) {
02715                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
02716                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
02717                 return rc;
02718         }
02719 
02720         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_LLOG_REMOVE, buf);
02721         if (rc == 0) {
02722                 if (argc == 2)
02723                         fprintf(stdout, "log %s is removed.\n", argv[1]);
02724                 else
02725                         fprintf(stdout, "the log in catalog %s is removed. \n",
02726                                 argv[1]);
02727         } else
02728                 fprintf(stderr, "OBD_IOC_LLOG_REMOVE failed: %s\n",
02729                         strerror(errno));
02730 
02731         return rc;
02732 }
02733 
02734 /* attach a regular file to virtual block device.
02735  * return vaule:
02736  *  -1: fatal error
02737  *  1: error, it always means the command run failed
02738  *  0: success
02739  */
02740 static int jt_blockdev_run_process(const char *file, char *argv[])
02741 {
02742         pid_t pid;
02743         int rc;
02744 
02745         pid = vfork();
02746         if (pid == 0) { /* child process */
02747                 /* don't print error messages */
02748                 close(1), close(2);
02749                 (void)execvp(file, argv);
02750                 exit(-1);
02751         } else if (pid > 0) {
02752                 int status;
02753 
02754                 rc = waitpid(pid, &status, 0);
02755                 if (rc < 0 || !WIFEXITED(status))
02756                         return -1;
02757 
02758                 return WEXITSTATUS(status);
02759         }
02760 
02761         return -1;
02762 }
02763 
02764 static int jt_blockdev_find_module(const char *module)
02765 {
02766         FILE *fp;
02767         int found = 0;
02768         char buf[1024];
02769         char *ptr;
02770 
02771         fp = fopen("/proc/modules", "r");
02772         if (fp == NULL)
02773                 return -1;
02774 
02775         while (fgets(buf, 1024, fp) != NULL) {
02776                 ptr = strchr(buf, ' ');
02777                 if (ptr != NULL)
02778                         *ptr = 0;
02779                 if (strcmp(module, buf) == 0) {
02780                         found = 1;
02781                         break;
02782                 }
02783         }
02784         fclose(fp);
02785 
02786         return found;
02787 }
02788 
02789 static int jt_blockdev_probe_module(const char *module)
02790 {
02791         char buf[1024];
02792         char *argv[10];
02793         int c, rc;
02794 
02795         if (jt_blockdev_find_module(module) == 1)
02796                 return 0;
02797 
02798         /* run modprobe first */
02799         c = 0;
02800         argv[c++] = "/sbin/modprobe";
02801         argv[c++] = "-q";
02802         argv[c++] = (char *)module;
02803         argv[c++] = NULL;
02804         rc = jt_blockdev_run_process("modprobe", argv);
02805         if (rc != 1)
02806                 return rc;
02807 
02808         /* cannot find the module in default directory ... */
02809         sprintf(buf, "../llite/%s.ko", module);
02810         c = 0;
02811         argv[c++] = "/sbin/insmod";
02812         argv[c++] = buf;
02813         argv[c++] = NULL;
02814         rc = jt_blockdev_run_process("insmod", argv);
02815         return rc ? -1 : 0;
02816 }
02817 
02818 int jt_blockdev_attach(int argc, char **argv)
02819 {
02820         int rc, fd;
02821         struct stat st;
02822         char *filename, *devname;
02823         unsigned long dev;
02824 
02825         if (argc != 3)
02826                 return CMD_HELP;
02827 
02828         if (jt_blockdev_probe_module("llite_lloop") < 0) {
02829                 fprintf(stderr, "error: cannot find module llite_lloop.(k)o\n");
02830                 return ENOENT;
02831         }
02832 
02833         filename = argv[1];
02834         devname = argv[2];
02835 
02836         fd = open(filename, O_RDWR);
02837         if (fd < 0) {
02838                 fprintf(stderr, "file %s can't be opened(%s)\n\n",
02839                         filename, strerror(errno));
02840                 return CMD_HELP;
02841         }
02842 
02843         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_LLOOP_ATTACH, &dev);
02844         if (rc < 0) {
02845                 rc = errno;
02846                 fprintf(stderr, "attach error(%s)\n", strerror(rc));
02847                 goto out;
02848         }
02849 
02850         rc = stat(devname, &st);
02851         if (rc == 0 && (!S_ISBLK(st.st_mode) || st.st_rdev != dev)) {
02852                 rc = EEXIST;
02853         } else if (rc < 0) {
02854                 if (errno == ENOENT &&
02855                     !mknod(devname, S_IFBLK|S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR, dev))
02856                         rc = 0;
02857                 else
02858                         rc = errno;
02859         }
02860 
02861         if (rc) {
02862                 fprintf(stderr, "error: the file %s could be attached to block "
02863                                 "device %X but creating %s failed: %s\n"
02864                                 "now detaching the block device..",
02865                         filename, (int)dev, devname, strerror(rc));
02866 
02867                 (void)ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_LLOOP_DETACH_BYDEV, dev);
02868                 fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", strerror(errno));
02869         }
02870 out:
02871         close(fd);
02872         return -rc;
02873 }
02874 
02875 int jt_blockdev_detach(int argc, char **argv)
02876 {
02877         char *filename;
02878         int rc, fd;
02879 
02880         if (argc != 2)
02881                 return CMD_HELP;
02882 
02883         filename = argv[1];
02884         fd = open(filename, O_RDONLY);
02885         if (fd < 0) {
02886                 fprintf(stderr, "cannot open file %s error %s\n",
02887                         filename, strerror(errno));
02888                 return CMD_HELP;
02889         }
02890 
02891         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_LLOOP_DETACH, 0);
02892         if (rc < 0) {
02893                 rc = errno;
02894                 fprintf(stderr, "detach error(%s)\n", strerror(rc));
02895         } else {
02896                 (void)unlink(filename);
02897         }
02898 
02899         close(fd);
02900         return -rc;
02901 }
02902 
02903 int jt_blockdev_info(int argc, char **argv)
02904 {
02905         char *filename;
02906         int rc, fd;
02907         struct lu_fid fid;
02908 
02909         if (argc != 2)
02910                 return CMD_HELP;
02911 
02912         filename = argv[1];
02913         fd = open(filename, O_RDONLY);
02914         if (fd < 0) {
02915                 fprintf(stderr, "cannot open file %s error: %s\n",
02916                         filename, strerror(errno));
02917                 return CMD_HELP;
02918         }
02919 
02920         rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_LLOOP_INFO, &fid);
02921         if (rc < 0) {
02922                 rc = errno;
02923                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s\n", strerror(errno));
02924                 goto out;
02925         }
02926         fprintf(stdout, "lloop device info: ");
02927         if (fid_is_zero(&fid))
02928                 fprintf(stdout, "Not attached\n");
02929         else
02930                 fprintf(stdout, "attached to inode "DFID"\n", PFID(&fid));
02931 out:
02932         close(fd);
02933         return -rc;
02934 }
02935 
02936 static void signal_server(int sig)
02937 {
02938         if (sig == SIGINT) {
02939                 do_disconnect("sigint", 1);
02940                 exit(1);
02941         } else
02942                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: got signal %d\n", jt_cmdname("sigint"), sig);
02943 }
02944 
02945 int obd_initialize(int argc, char **argv)
02946 {
02947         if (shmem_setup() != 0)
02948                 return -1;
02949 
02950         register_ioc_dev(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_DEV_PATH,
02951                          OBD_DEV_MAJOR, OBD_DEV_MINOR);
02952 
02953         return 0;
02954 }
02955 
02956 void obd_finalize(int argc, char **argv)
02957 {
02958         struct sigaction sigact;
02959 
02960         /* sigact initialization */
02961         sigact.sa_handler = signal_server;
02962         sigfillset(&sigact.sa_mask);
02963         sigact.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
02964         /* coverity[uninit_use_in_call] */
02965         sigaction(SIGINT, &sigact, NULL);
02966 
02967         shmem_cleanup();
02968         do_disconnect(argv[0], 1);
02969 }
02970 
02971 static int check_pool_cmd(enum lcfg_command_type cmd,
02972                           char *fsname, char *poolname,
02973                           char *ostname)
02974 {
02975         int rc;
02976 
02977         rc = llapi_search_ost(fsname, poolname, ostname);
02978         if (rc < 0 && (cmd != LCFG_POOL_NEW)) {
02979                 fprintf(stderr, "Pool %s.%s not found\n",
02980                         fsname, poolname);
02981                 return rc;
02982         }
02983 
02984         switch (cmd) {
02985         case LCFG_POOL_NEW: {
02986                 LASSERT(ostname == NULL);
02987                 if (rc >= 0) {
02988                         fprintf(stderr, "Pool %s.%s already exists\n",
02989                                 fsname, poolname);
02990                         return -EEXIST;
02991                 }
02992                 return 0;
02993         }
02994         case LCFG_POOL_DEL: {
02995                 LASSERT(ostname == NULL);
02996                 if (rc == 1) {
02997                         fprintf(stderr, "Pool %s.%s not empty, "
02998                                 "please remove all members\n",
02999                                 fsname, poolname);
03000                         return -ENOTEMPTY;
03001                 }
03002                 return 0;
03003         }
03004         case LCFG_POOL_ADD: {
03005                 if (rc == 1) {
03006                         fprintf(stderr, "OST %s is already in pool %s.%s\n",
03007                                 ostname, fsname, poolname);
03008                         return -EEXIST;
03009                 }
03010                 rc = llapi_search_ost(fsname, NULL, ostname);
03011                 if (rc == 0) {
03012                         fprintf(stderr, "OST %s is not part of the '%s' fs.\n",
03013                                 ostname, fsname);
03014                         return -ENOENT;
03015                 }
03016                 return 0;
03017         }
03018         case LCFG_POOL_REM: {
03019                 if (rc == 0) {
03020                         fprintf(stderr, "OST %s not found in pool %s.%s\n",
03021                                 ostname, fsname, poolname);
03022                         return -ENOENT;
03023                 }
03024                 return 0;
03025         }
03026         default:
03027                 break;
03028         } /* switch */
03029         return -EINVAL;
03030 }
03031 
03032 /* This check only verifies that the changes have been "pushed out" to
03033    the client successfully.  This involves waiting for a config update,
03034    and so may fail because of problems in that code or post-command
03035    network loss. So reporting a warning is appropriate, but not a failure.
03036 */
03037 static int check_pool_cmd_result(enum lcfg_command_type cmd,
03038                                  char *fsname, char *poolname,
03039                                  char *ostname)
03040 {
03041         int cpt = 10;
03042         int rc = 0;
03043 
03044         switch (cmd) {
03045         case LCFG_POOL_NEW: {
03046                 do {
03047                         rc = llapi_search_ost(fsname, poolname, NULL);
03048                         if (rc == -ENODEV)
03049                                 return rc;
03050                         if (rc < 0)
03051                                 sleep(2);
03052                         cpt--;
03053                 } while ((rc < 0) && (cpt > 0));
03054                 if (rc >= 0) {
03055                         fprintf(stderr, "Pool %s.%s created\n",
03056                                 fsname, poolname);
03057                         return 0;
03058                 } else {
03059                         fprintf(stderr, "Warning, pool %s.%s not found\n",
03060                                 fsname, poolname);
03061                         return -ENOENT;
03062                 }
03063         }
03064         case LCFG_POOL_DEL: {
03065                 do {
03066                         rc = llapi_search_ost(fsname, poolname, NULL);
03067                         if (rc == -ENODEV)
03068                                 return rc;
03069                         if (rc >= 0)
03070                                 sleep(2);
03071                         cpt--;
03072                 } while ((rc >= 0) && (cpt > 0));
03073                 if (rc < 0) {
03074                         fprintf(stderr, "Pool %s.%s destroyed\n",
03075                                 fsname, poolname);
03076                         return 0;
03077                 } else {
03078                         fprintf(stderr, "Warning, pool %s.%s still found\n",
03079                                 fsname, poolname);
03080                         return -EEXIST;
03081                 }
03082         }
03083         case LCFG_POOL_ADD: {
03084                 do {
03085                         rc = llapi_search_ost(fsname, poolname, ostname);
03086                         if (rc == -ENODEV)
03087                                 return rc;
03088                         if (rc != 1)
03089                                 sleep(2);
03090                         cpt--;
03091                 } while ((rc != 1) && (cpt > 0));
03092                 if (rc == 1) {
03093                         fprintf(stderr, "OST %s added to pool %s.%s\n",
03094                                 ostname, fsname, poolname);
03095                         return 0;
03096                 } else {
03097                         fprintf(stderr, "Warning, OST %s not found in pool %s.%s\n",
03098                                 ostname, fsname, poolname);
03099                         return -ENOENT;
03100                 }
03101         }
03102         case LCFG_POOL_REM: {
03103                 do {
03104                         rc = llapi_search_ost(fsname, poolname, ostname);
03105                         if (rc == -ENODEV)
03106                                 return rc;
03107                         if (rc == 1)
03108                                 sleep(2);
03109                         cpt--;
03110                 } while ((rc == 1) && (cpt > 0));
03111                 if (rc != 1) {
03112                         fprintf(stderr, "OST %s removed from pool %s.%s\n",
03113                                 ostname, fsname, poolname);
03114                         return 0;
03115                 } else {
03116                         fprintf(stderr, "Warning, OST %s still found in pool %s.%s\n",
03117                                 ostname, fsname, poolname);
03118                         return -EEXIST;
03119                 }
03120         }
03121         default:
03122                 break;
03123         }
03124         return -EINVAL;
03125 }
03126 
03127 static int check_and_complete_ostname(char *fsname, char *ostname)
03128 {
03129         char *ptr;
03130         char real_ostname[MAX_OBD_NAME + 1];
03131         char i;
03132 
03133         /* if OST name does not start with fsname, we add it */
03134         /* if not check if the fsname is the right one */
03135         ptr = strchr(ostname, '-');
03136         if (ptr == NULL) {
03137                 sprintf(real_ostname, "%s-%s", fsname, ostname);
03138         } else if (strncmp(ostname, fsname, strlen(fsname)) != 0) {
03139                 fprintf(stderr, "%s does not start with fsname %s\n",
03140                         ostname, fsname);
03141                 return -EINVAL;
03142         } else {
03143                 if (strlen(ostname) > sizeof(real_ostname)-1)
03144                         return -E2BIG;
03145                 strncpy(real_ostname, ostname, sizeof(real_ostname));
03146         }
03147         /* real_ostname is fsname-????? */
03148         ptr = real_ostname + strlen(fsname) + 1;
03149         if (strncmp(ptr, "OST", 3) != 0) {
03150                 fprintf(stderr, "%s does not start by %s-OST nor OST\n",
03151                         ostname, fsname);
03152                 return -EINVAL;
03153         }
03154         /* real_ostname is fsname-OST????? */
03155         ptr += 3;
03156         for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
03157                 if (!isxdigit(*ptr)) {
03158                         fprintf(stderr,
03159                                 "ost's index in %s is not an hexa number\n",
03160                                 ostname);
03161                         return -EINVAL;
03162                 }
03163                 ptr++;
03164         }
03165         /* real_ostname is fsname-OSTXXXX????? */
03166         /* if OST name does not end with _UUID, we add it */
03167         if (*ptr == '\0') {
03168                 strcat(real_ostname, "_UUID");
03169         } else if (strcmp(ptr, "_UUID") != 0) {
03170                 fprintf(stderr,
03171                         "ostname %s does not end with _UUID\n", ostname);
03172                 return -EINVAL;
03173         }
03174         /* real_ostname is fsname-OSTXXXX_UUID */
03175         strcpy(ostname, real_ostname);
03176         return 0;
03177 }
03178 
03179 /* returns 0 or -errno */
03180 static int pool_cmd(enum lcfg_command_type cmd,
03181                     char *cmdname, char *fullpoolname,
03182                     char *fsname, char *poolname, char *ostname)
03183 {
03184         int rc = 0;
03185         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
03186         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
03187         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
03188         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
03189 
03190         rc = check_pool_cmd(cmd, fsname, poolname, ostname);
03191         if (rc == -ENODEV)
03192                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't verify pool command since there "
03193                         "is no local MDT or client, proceeding anyhow...\n");
03194         else if (rc)
03195                 return rc;
03196 
03197         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, NULL);
03198         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 0, cmdname);
03199         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, fullpoolname);
03200         if (ostname != NULL)
03201                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 2, ostname);
03202 
03203         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(cmd, &bufs);
03204         if (lcfg == NULL)
03205                 return -ENOMEM;
03206 
03207         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
03208         rc = data.ioc_dev = get_mgs_device();
03209         if (rc < 0)
03210                 goto out;
03211 
03212         data.ioc_type = LUSTRE_CFG_TYPE;
03213         data.ioc_plen1 = lustre_cfg_len(lcfg->lcfg_bufcount,
03214                                         lcfg->lcfg_buflens);
03215         data.ioc_pbuf1 = (void *)lcfg;
03216 
03217         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
03218         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
03219         if (rc) {
03220                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
03221                         jt_cmdname(cmdname));
03222                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
03223                 return rc;
03224         }
03225         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_POOL, buf);
03226 out:
03227         if (rc)
03228                 rc = -errno;
03229         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
03230         return rc;
03231 }
03232 
03245 static int nodemap_cmd(enum lcfg_command_type cmd, void *ret_data,
03246                        unsigned int ret_size, ...)
03247 {
03248         va_list                 ap;
03249         char                    *arg;
03250         int                     i = 0;
03251         struct lustre_cfg_bufs  bufs;
03252         struct obd_ioctl_data   data;
03253         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg;
03254         char                    rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN];
03255         char                    *buf = rawbuf;
03256         int                     rc = 0;
03257 
03258         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, NULL);
03259 
03260         va_start(ap, ret_size);
03261         arg = va_arg(ap, char *);
03262         while (arg != NULL) {
03263                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, i, arg);
03264                 i++;
03265                 arg = va_arg(ap, char *);
03266         }
03267         va_end(ap);
03268 
03269         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(cmd, &bufs);
03270         if (lcfg == NULL)
03271                 return -ENOMEM;
03272 
03273         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
03274         rc = data.ioc_dev = get_mgs_device();
03275         if (rc < 0)
03276                 goto out;
03277 
03278         data.ioc_type = LUSTRE_CFG_TYPE;
03279         data.ioc_plen1 = lustre_cfg_len(lcfg->lcfg_bufcount,
03280                          lcfg->lcfg_buflens);
03281         data.ioc_pbuf1 = (void *)lcfg;
03282 
03283         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
03284         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
03285         if (rc != 0) {
03286                 fprintf(stderr, "error: invalid ioctl: %08x errno: %d with "
03287                                "rc=%d\n", cmd, errno, rc);
03288                 goto out;
03289         }
03290 
03291         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_NODEMAP, buf);
03292         if (rc != 0) {
03293                 fprintf(stderr, "error: invalid ioctl: %08x errno: %d with "
03294                                "rc=%d\n", cmd, errno, rc);
03295                 goto out;
03296         }
03297 
03298         if (ret_data != NULL) {
03299                 rc = obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
03300                 if (rc != 0)
03301                         goto out;
03302 
03303                 if (ret_size > data.ioc_plen1)
03304                         ret_size = data.ioc_plen1;
03305 
03306                 memcpy(ret_data, data.ioc_pbuf1, ret_size);
03307         }
03308 out:
03309         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
03310 
03311         return rc;
03312 }
03313 
03324 int jt_nodemap_activate(int argc, char **argv)
03325 {
03326         int rc;
03327 
03328         rc = nodemap_cmd(LCFG_NODEMAP_ACTIVATE, NULL, 0, argv[0], argv[1],
03329                          NULL);
03330 
03331         if (rc != 0) {
03332                 errno = -rc;
03333                 perror(argv[0]);
03334         }
03335 
03336         return rc;
03337 }
03338 
03349 int jt_nodemap_add(int argc, char **argv)
03350 {
03351         int rc;
03352 
03353         rc = llapi_nodemap_exists(argv[1]);
03354         if (rc == 0) {
03355                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s existing nodemap name\n", argv[1]);
03356                 return 1;
03357         }
03358 
03359         rc = nodemap_cmd(LCFG_NODEMAP_ADD, NULL, 0, argv[0], argv[1], NULL);
03360 
03361         if (rc != 0) {
03362                 errno = -rc;
03363                 perror(argv[0]);
03364         }
03365 
03366         return rc;
03367 }
03368 
03379 int jt_nodemap_del(int argc, char **argv)
03380 {
03381         int rc;
03382 
03383         rc = llapi_nodemap_exists(argv[1]);
03384         if (rc != 0) {
03385                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s not existing nodemap name\n",
03386                         argv[1]);
03387                 return rc;
03388         }
03389         rc = nodemap_cmd(LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL, NULL, 0, argv[0], argv[1], NULL);
03390 
03391         if (rc != 0) {
03392                 errno = -rc;
03393                 perror(argv[0]);
03394         }
03395 
03396         return rc;
03397 }
