03435 int jt_nodemap_test_id(int argc, char **argv)
03436 {
03437         char    rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN];
03438         char    *nidstr = NULL;
03439         char    *idstr = NULL;
03440         char    *typestr = NULL;
03441         int     rc = 0;
03442         int     c;
03443 
03444         static struct option long_options[] = {
03445                 {
03446                         .name           = "nid",
03447                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03448                         .flag           = 0,
03449                         .val            = 'n',
03450                 },
03451                 {
03452                         .name           = "idtype",
03453                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03454                         .flag           = 0,
03455                         .val            = 't',
03456                 },
03457                 {
03458                         .name           = "id",
03459                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03460                         .flag           = 0,
03461                         .val            = 'i',
03462                 },
03463                 {
03464                         NULL
03465                 }
03466         };
03467 
03468         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "n:t:i:",
03469                                 long_options, NULL)) != -1) {
03470                 switch (c) {
03471                 case 'n':
03472                         nidstr = optarg;
03473                         break;
03474                 case 't':
03475                         typestr = optarg;
03476                         break;
03477                 case 'i':
03478                         idstr = optarg;
03479                         break;
03480                 }
03481         }
03482 
03483         if (nidstr == NULL || typestr == NULL || idstr == NULL) {
03484                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: nodemap_test_id --nid <nid> "
03485                                 "--idtype [uid|gid] --id <id>\n");
03486                 return -1;
03487         }
03488 
03489         rc = nodemap_cmd(LCFG_NODEMAP_TEST_ID, &rawbuf, sizeof(rawbuf),
03490                          argv[0], nidstr, typestr, idstr);
03491         if (rc == 0)
03492                 printf("%s\n", (char *)rawbuf);
03493 
03494         return rc;
03495 }
03496 
03508 int jt_nodemap_add_range(int argc, char **argv)
03509 {
03510         char                    *nodemap_name = NULL;
03511         char                    *nodemap_range = NULL;
03512         struct list_head        nidlist;
03513         char                    min_nid[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE + 1];
03514         char                    max_nid[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE + 1];
03515         char                    nid_range[2 * LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE + 2];
03516         int                     rc = 0;
03517         int                     c;
03518 
03519         static struct option long_options[] = {
03520                 {
03521                         .name           = "name",
03522                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03523                         .flag           = 0,
03524                         .val            = 'n',
03525                 },
03526                 {
03527                         .name           = "range",
03528                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03529                         .flag           = 0,
03530                         .val            = 'r',
03531                 },
03532                 {
03533                         NULL
03534                 }
03535         };
03536 
03537         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&nidlist);
03538 
03539         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "n:r:",
03540                                 long_options, NULL)) != -1) {
03541                 switch (c) {
03542                 case 'n':
03543                         nodemap_name = optarg;
03544                         break;
03545                 case 'r':
03546                         nodemap_range = optarg;
03547                         break;
03548                 }
03549         }
03550 
03551         if (nodemap_name == NULL || nodemap_range == NULL) {
03552                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: nodemap_add_range --name <name> "
03553                                 "--range <range>\n");
03554                 return -1;
03555         }
03556 
03557         if (cfs_parse_nidlist(nodemap_range, strlen(nodemap_range),
03558                               &nidlist) <= 0) {
03559                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: can't parse nid range: %s\n",
03560                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), nodemap_range);
03561                 return -1;
03562         }
03563 
03564         if (!cfs_nidrange_is_contiguous(&nidlist)) {
03565                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: nodemap ranges must be "
03566                         "contiguous\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
03567                 return -1;
03568         }
03569 
03570         cfs_nidrange_find_min_max(&nidlist, &min_nid[0], &max_nid[0],
03571                                   LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE);
03572         snprintf(nid_range, sizeof(nid_range), "%s:%s", min_nid, max_nid);
03573 
03574         rc = nodemap_cmd(LCFG_NODEMAP_ADD_RANGE, NULL, 0, argv[0],
03575                          nodemap_name, nid_range, NULL);
03576         if (rc != 0) {
03577                 errno = -rc;
03578                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cannot add range '%s' to nodemap "
03579                                 "'%s': rc = %d\n",
03580                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), nodemap_range, nodemap_name, rc);
03581         }
03582 
03583         return rc;
03584 }
03585 
03597 int jt_nodemap_del_range(int argc, char **argv)
03598 {
03599         char                    *nodemap_name = NULL;
03600         char                    *nodemap_range = NULL;
03601         struct list_head        nidlist;
03602         char                    min_nid[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE + 1];
03603         char                    max_nid[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE + 1];
03604         char                    nid_range[2 * LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE + 2];
03605         int                     rc = 0;
03606         int                     c;
03607 
03608         static struct option long_options[] = {
03609                 {
03610                         .name           = "name",
03611                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03612                         .flag           = 0,
03613                         .val            = 'n',
03614                 },
03615                 {
03616                         .name           = "range",
03617                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03618                         .flag           = 0,
03619                         .val            = 'r',
03620                 },
03621                 {
03622                         NULL
03623                 }
03624         };
03625 
03626         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&nidlist);
03627 
03628         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "n:r:",
03629                                 long_options, NULL)) != -1) {
03630                 switch (c) {
03631                 case 'n':
03632                         nodemap_name = optarg;
03633                         break;
03634                 case 'r':
03635                         nodemap_range = optarg;
03636                         break;
03637                 }
03638         }
03639 
03640         if (nodemap_name == NULL || nodemap_range == NULL) {
03641                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: nodemap_del_range --name <name> "
03642                                 "--range <range>\n");
03643                 return -1;
03644         }
03645 
03646         if (cfs_parse_nidlist(nodemap_range, strlen(nodemap_range),
03647                               &nidlist) <= 0) {
03648                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: can't parse nid range: %s\n",
03649                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), nodemap_range);
03650                 return -1;
03651         }
03652 
03653         if (!cfs_nidrange_is_contiguous(&nidlist)) {
03654                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: nodemap ranges must be "
03655                         "contiguous\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
03656                 return -1;
03657         }
03658 
03659         cfs_nidrange_find_min_max(&nidlist, &min_nid[0], &max_nid[0],
03660                                   LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE);
03661         snprintf(nid_range, sizeof(nid_range), "%s:%s", min_nid, max_nid);
03662 
03663         rc = nodemap_cmd(LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL_RANGE, NULL, 0, argv[0],
03664                          nodemap_name, nid_range, NULL);
03665         if (rc != 0) {
03666                 errno = -rc;
03667                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cannot delete range '%s' to "
03668                                "nodemap '%s': rc = %d\n",
03669                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), nodemap_range, nodemap_name, rc);
03670         }
03671 
03672         return rc;
03673 }
03674 
03688 int jt_nodemap_modify(int argc, char **argv)
03689 {
03690         int                     c;
03691         int                     rc = 0;
03692         enum lcfg_command_type  cmd = 0;
03693         char                    *nodemap_name = NULL;
03694         char                    *param = NULL;
03695         char                    *value = NULL;
03696 
03697         static struct option long_options[] = {
03698                 {
03699                         .name           = "name",
03700                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03701                         .flag           = 0,
03702                         .val            = 'n',
03703                 },
03704                 {
03705                         .name           = "property",
03706                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03707                         .flag           = 0,
03708                         .val            = 'p',
03709                 },
03710                 {
03711                         .name           = "value",
03712                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03713                         .flag           = 0,
03714                         .val            = 'v',
03715                 },
03716                 {
03717                         NULL
03718                 }
03719         };
03720 
03721         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "n:p:v:",
03722                                 long_options, NULL)) != -1) {
03723                 switch (c) {
03724                 case 'n':
03725                         nodemap_name = optarg;
03726                         break;
03727                 case 'p':
03728                         param = optarg;
03729                         break;
03730                 case 'v':
03731                         value = optarg;
03732                         break;
03733                 }
03734         }
03735 
03736         if (nodemap_name == NULL || param == NULL || value == NULL) {
03737                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: nodemap_modify --name <nodemap_name> "
03738                                 "--property <property_name> --value <value>\n");
03739                 fprintf(stderr, "valid properties: admin trusted "
03740                                 "squash_uid squash_gid\n");
03741                 return -1;
03742         }
03743 
03744         if (strcmp("admin", param) == 0) {
03745                 cmd = LCFG_NODEMAP_ADMIN;
03746         } else if (strcmp("trusted", param) == 0) {
03747                 cmd = LCFG_NODEMAP_TRUSTED;
03748         } else if (strcmp("squash_uid", param) == 0) {
03749                 cmd = LCFG_NODEMAP_SQUASH_UID;
03750         } else if (strcmp("squash_gid", param) == 0) {
03751                 cmd = LCFG_NODEMAP_SQUASH_GID;
03752         } else {
03753                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: nodemap_modify invalid "
03754                                 "subcommand: %s\n",
03755                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), param);
03756                 return -1;
03757         }
03758 
03759         rc = nodemap_cmd(cmd, NULL, 0, argv[0], nodemap_name, param,
03760                          value, NULL);
03761         if (rc != 0) {
03762                 errno = -rc;
03763                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cannot modify nodemap '%s' "
03764                                "to param '%s': value '%s': rc = %d\n",
03765                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), nodemap_name, param, value, rc);
03766         }
03767 
03768         return rc;
03769 }
03770 
03771 int jt_nodemap_add_idmap(int argc, char **argv)
03772 {
03773         int                     c;
03774         enum                    lcfg_command_type cmd = 0;
03775         char                    *nodemap_name = NULL;
03776         char                    *idmap = NULL;
03777         char                    *idtype = NULL;
03778         int                     rc = 0;
03779 
03780         static struct option long_options[] = {
03781                 {
03782                         .name           = "name",
03783                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03784                         .flag           = 0,
03785                         .val            = 'n',
03786                 },
03787                 {
03788                         .name           = "idmap",
03789                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03790                         .flag           = 0,
03791                         .val            = 'm',
03792                 },
03793                 {
03794                         .name           = "idtype",
03795                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03796                         .flag           = 0,
03797                         .val            = 'i',
03798                 },
03799                 {
03800                         NULL
03801                 }
03802         };
03803 
03804         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "n:m:i:",
03805                                 long_options, NULL)) != -1) {
03806                 switch (c) {
03807                 case 'n':
03808                         nodemap_name = optarg;
03809                         break;
03810                 case 'm':
03811                         idmap = optarg;
03812                         break;
03813                 case 'i':
03814                         idtype = optarg;
03815                         break;
03816                 }
03817         }
03818 
03819         if (nodemap_name == NULL || idmap == NULL || idtype == NULL) {
03820                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s --name <name> --idtype [uid | gid]"
03821                         " --idmap <client id>:<filesystem id>\n", argv[0]);
03822                 return -1;
03823         }
03824 
03825         if (strcmp("uid", idtype) == 0) {
03826                 cmd = LCFG_NODEMAP_ADD_UIDMAP;
03827         } else if (strcmp("gid", idtype) == 0) {
03828                 cmd = LCFG_NODEMAP_ADD_GIDMAP;
03829         } else {
03830                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s --name <name> --idtype [uid | gid]"
03831                         " --idmap <client id>:<filesystem id>\n", argv[0]);
03832                 return -1;
03833         }
03834 
03835         rc = nodemap_cmd(cmd, NULL, 0, argv[0], nodemap_name, idmap, NULL);
03836         if (rc != 0) {
03837                 errno = -rc;
03838                 fprintf(stderr, "cannot add %smap '%s' to nodemap '%s'"
03839                         ": rc = %d\n", idtype, idmap, nodemap_name, rc);
03840         }
03841 
03842         return rc;
03843 }
03844 
03845 int jt_nodemap_del_idmap(int argc, char **argv)
03846 {
03847         int                     c;
03848         enum                    lcfg_command_type cmd = 0;
03849         char                    *nodemap_name = NULL;
03850         char                    *idmap = NULL;
03851         char                    *idtype = NULL;
03852         int                     rc = 0;
03853 
03854         static struct option long_options[] = {
03855                 {
03856                         .name           = "name",
03857                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03858                         .flag           = 0,
03859                         .val            = 'n',
03860                 },
03861                 {
03862                         .name           = "idmap",
03863                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03864                         .flag           = 0,
03865                         .val            = 'm',
03866                 },
03867                 {
03868                         .name           = "idtype",
03869                         .has_arg        = required_argument,
03870                         .flag           = 0,
03871                         .val            = 'i',
03872                 },
03873                 {
03874                         NULL
03875                 }
03876         };
03877 
03878         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "n:m:i:",
03879                                 long_options, NULL)) != -1) {
03880                 switch (c) {
03881                 case 'n':
03882                         nodemap_name = optarg;
03883                         break;
03884                 case 'm':
03885                         idmap = optarg;
03886                         break;
03887                 case 'i':
03888                         idtype = optarg;
03889                         break;
03890                 }
03891         }
03892 
03893         if (nodemap_name == NULL || idmap == NULL || idtype == NULL) {
03894                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s --name <name> --idtype [uid | gid]"
03895                         " --idmap <client id>:<filesystem id>\n", argv[0]);
03896                 return -1;
03897         }
03898 
03899         if (strcmp("uid", idtype) == 0)
03900                 cmd = LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL_UIDMAP;
03901         else
03902                 cmd = LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL_GIDMAP;
03903 
03904         rc = nodemap_cmd(cmd, NULL, 0, argv[0], nodemap_name, idmap, NULL);
03905         if (rc != 0) {
03906                 errno = -rc;
03907                 fprintf(stderr, "cannot delete %smap '%s' from nodemap '%s'"
03908                         ": rc = %d\n", idtype, idmap, nodemap_name, rc);
03909         }
03910 
03911         return rc;
03912 }
03913 
03914 /*
03915  * this function tranforms a rule [start-end/step] into an array
03916  * of matching numbers
03917  * supported forms are:
03918  * [start]                : just this number
03919  * [start-end]            : all numbers from start to end
03920  * [start-end/step]       : numbers from start to end with increment of step
03921  * on return, format contains a printf format string which can be used
03922  * to generate all the strings
03923  */
03924 static int get_array_idx(char *rule, char *format, int **array)
03925 {
03926         char *start, *end, *ptr;
03927         unsigned int lo, hi, step;
03928         int array_sz = 0;
03929         int i, array_idx;
03930         int rc;
03931 
03932         start = strchr(rule, '[');
03933         end = strchr(rule, ']');
03934         if ((start == NULL) || (end == NULL)) {
03935                 *array = malloc(sizeof(int));
03936                 if (*array == NULL)
03937                         return 0;
03938                 strcpy(format, rule);
03939                 array_sz = 1;
03940                 return array_sz;
03941         }
03942         *start = '\0';
03943         *end = '\0';
03944         end++;
03945         start++;
03946         /* put in format the printf format (the rule without the range) */
03947         sprintf(format, "%s%%.4x%s", rule, end);
03948 
03949         array_idx = 0;
03950         array_sz = 0;
03951         *array = NULL;
03952         /* loop on , separator */
03953         do {
03954                 /* extract the 3 fields */
03955                 rc = sscanf(start, "%x-%x/%u", &lo, &hi, &step);
03956                 switch (rc) {
03957                 case 0:
03958                         goto err;
03959                 case 1: {
03960                         void *tmp;
03961 
03962                         array_sz++;
03963                         tmp = realloc(*array, array_sz * sizeof(int));
03964                         if (tmp == NULL)
03965                                 goto err;
03966                         *array = tmp;
03967                         (*array)[array_idx] = lo;
03968                         array_idx++;
03969                         break;
03970                 }
03971                 case 2: {
03972                         step = 1;
03973                         /* do not break to share code with case 3: */
03974                 }
03975                 case 3: {
03976                         void *tmp;
03977 
03978                         if ((hi < lo) || (step == 0))
03979                                 goto err;
03980                         array_sz += (hi - lo) / step + 1;
03981                         tmp = realloc(*array, array_sz * sizeof(int));
03982                         if (tmp == NULL)
03983                                 goto err;
03984                         *array = tmp;
03985                         for (i = lo; i <= hi; i+=step, array_idx++)
03986                                 (*array)[array_idx] = i;
03987                         break;
03988                 }
03989                 }
03990                 ptr = strchr(start, ',');
03991                 if (ptr != NULL)
03992                         start = ptr + 1;
03993 
03994         } while (ptr != NULL);
03995         return array_sz;
03996 err:
03997         if (*array != NULL) {
03998                 free(*array);
03999                 *array = NULL;
04000         }
04001         return 0;
04002 }
04003 
04004 static int extract_fsname_poolname(const char *arg, char *fsname,
04005                                    char *poolname)
04006 {
04007         char *ptr;
04008         int rc;
04009 
04010         strlcpy(fsname, arg, PATH_MAX + 1);
04011         ptr = strchr(fsname, '.');
04012         if (ptr == NULL) {
04013                 fprintf(stderr, ". is missing in %s\n", fsname);
04014                 rc = -EINVAL;
04015                 goto err;
04016         }
04017 
04018         if ((ptr - fsname) == 0) {
04019                 fprintf(stderr, "fsname is empty\n");
04020                 rc = -EINVAL;
04021                 goto err;
04022         }
04023 
04024         *ptr = '\0';
04025         ++ptr;
04026 
04027         rc = lustre_is_fsname_valid(fsname, 1, LUSTRE_MAXFSNAME);
04028         if (rc < 0) {
04029                 fprintf(stderr, "filesystem name %s must be 1-%d chars\n",
04030                         fsname, LUSTRE_MAXFSNAME);
04031                 rc = -EINVAL;
04032                 goto err;
04033         } else if (rc > 0) {
04034                 fprintf(stderr, "char '%c' not allowed in filesystem name\n",
04035                         rc);
04036                 rc = -EINVAL;
04037                 goto err;
04038         }
04039 
04040         rc = lustre_is_poolname_valid(ptr, 1, LOV_MAXPOOLNAME);
04041         if (rc == -1) {
04042                 fprintf(stderr, "poolname is empty\n");
04043                 rc = -EINVAL;
04044                 goto err;
04045         } else if (rc == -2) {
04046                 fprintf(stderr,
04047                         "poolname %s is too long (max is %d)\n",
04048                         ptr, LOV_MAXPOOLNAME);
04049                 rc = -ENAMETOOLONG;
04050                 goto err;
04051         } else if (rc > 0) {
04052                 fprintf(stderr, "char '%c' not allowed in pool name '%s'\n",
04053                         rc, ptr);
04054                 rc = -EINVAL;
04055                 goto err;
04056         }
04057 
04058         strncpy(poolname, ptr, LOV_MAXPOOLNAME);
04059         poolname[LOV_MAXPOOLNAME] = '\0';
04060         return 0;
04061 
04062 err:
04063         fprintf(stderr, "argument %s must be <fsname>.<poolname>\n", arg);
04064         return rc;
04065 }
04066 
04067 int jt_pool_cmd(int argc, char **argv)
04068 {
04069         enum lcfg_command_type cmd;
04070         char fsname[PATH_MAX + 1];
04071         char poolname[LOV_MAXPOOLNAME + 1];
04072         char *ostnames_buf = NULL;
04073         int i, rc;
04074         int *array = NULL, array_sz;
04075         struct {
04076                 int     rc;
04077                 char   *ostname;
04078         } *cmds = NULL;
04079 
04080         switch (argc) {
04081         case 0:
04082         case 1: return CMD_HELP;
04083         case 2: {
04084                 if (strcmp("pool_new", argv[0]) == 0)
04085                         cmd = LCFG_POOL_NEW;
04086                 else if (strcmp("pool_destroy", argv[0]) == 0)
04087                         cmd = LCFG_POOL_DEL;
04088                 else if (strcmp("pool_list", argv[0]) == 0)
04089                          return llapi_poollist(argv[1]);
04090                 else return CMD_HELP;
04091 
04092                 rc = extract_fsname_poolname(argv[1], fsname, poolname);
04093                 if (rc)
04094                         break;
04095 
04096                 rc = pool_cmd(cmd, argv[0], argv[1], fsname, poolname, NULL);
04097                 if (rc)
04098                         break;
04099 
04100                 check_pool_cmd_result(cmd, fsname, poolname, NULL);
04101                 break;
04102         }
04103         default: {
04104                 char format[2*MAX_OBD_NAME];
04105 
04106                 if (strcmp("pool_remove", argv[0]) == 0) {
04107                         cmd = LCFG_POOL_REM;
04108                 } else if (strcmp("pool_add", argv[0]) == 0) {
04109                         cmd = LCFG_POOL_ADD;
04110                 } else {
04111                         return CMD_HELP;
04112                 }
04113 
04114                 rc = extract_fsname_poolname(argv[1], fsname, poolname);
04115                 if (rc)
04116                         break;
04117 
04118                 for (i = 2; i < argc; i++) {
04119                         int j;
04120 
04121                         array_sz = get_array_idx(argv[i], format, &array);
04122                         if (array_sz == 0)
04123                                 return CMD_HELP;
04124 
04125                         cmds = malloc(array_sz * sizeof(cmds[0]));
04126                         if (cmds != NULL) {
04127                                 ostnames_buf = malloc(array_sz *
04128                                                       (MAX_OBD_NAME + 1));
04129                         } else {
04130                                 free(array);
04131                                 rc = -ENOMEM;
04132                                 goto out;
04133                         }
04134 
04135                         for (j = 0; j < array_sz; j++) {
04136                                 char ostname[MAX_OBD_NAME + 1];
04137 
04138                                 snprintf(ostname, MAX_OBD_NAME, format,
04139                                          array[j]);
04140                                 ostname[MAX_OBD_NAME] = '\0';
04141 
04142                                 rc = check_and_complete_ostname(fsname,ostname);
04143                                 if (rc) {
04144                                         free(array);
04145                                         free(cmds);
04146                                         if (ostnames_buf)
04147                                                 free(ostnames_buf);
04148                                         goto out;
04149                                 }
04150                                 if (ostnames_buf != NULL) {
04151                                         cmds[j].ostname =
04152                                           &ostnames_buf[(MAX_OBD_NAME + 1) * j];
04153                                         strcpy(cmds[j].ostname, ostname);
04154                                 } else {
04155                                         cmds[j].ostname = NULL;
04156                                 }
04157                                 cmds[j].rc = pool_cmd(cmd, argv[0], argv[1],
04158                                                       fsname, poolname,
04159                                                       ostname);
04160                                 /* Return an err if any of the add/dels fail */
04161                                 if (!rc)
04162                                         rc = cmds[j].rc;
04163                         }
04164                         for (j = 0; j < array_sz; j++) {
04165                                 if (!cmds[j].rc) {
04166                                         char ostname[MAX_OBD_NAME + 1];
04167 
04168                                         if (!cmds[j].ostname) {
04169                                                 snprintf(ostname, MAX_OBD_NAME,
04170                                                          format, array[j]);
04171                                                 ostname[MAX_OBD_NAME] = '\0';
04172                                                 check_and_complete_ostname(
04173                                                         fsname, ostname);
04174                                         } else {
04175                                                 strcpy(ostname,
04176                                                        cmds[j].ostname);
04177                                         }
04178                                         check_pool_cmd_result(cmd, fsname,
04179                                                               poolname,ostname);
04180                                 }
04181                         }
04182                         if (array_sz > 0)
04183                                 free(array);
04184                         if (cmds)
04185                                 free(cmds);
04186                         if (ostnames_buf != NULL)
04187                                 free(ostnames_buf);
04188                 }
04189                 /* fall through */
04190         }
04191         } /* switch */
04192 
04193 out:
04194         if (rc != 0) {
04195                 errno = -rc;
04196                 perror(argv[0]);
04197         }
04198 
04199         return rc;
04200 }
04201 
04202 int jt_get_obj_version(int argc, char **argv)
04203 {
04204         struct lu_fid fid;
04205         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
04206         __u64 version, id = ULLONG_MAX, group = ULLONG_MAX;
04207         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf, *fidstr;
04208         int rc, c;
04209 
04210         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "i:g:")) != -1) {
04211                 switch (c) {
04212                 case 'i':
04213                         id = strtoull(optarg, NULL, 0);
04214                         break;
04215                 case 'g':
04216                         group = strtoull(optarg, NULL, 0);
04217                         break;
04218                 default:
04219                         return CMD_HELP;
04220                 }
04221         }
04222 
04223         argc -= optind;
04224         argv += optind;
04225 
04226         if (!(id != ULLONG_MAX && group != ULLONG_MAX && argc == 0) &&
04227             !(id == ULLONG_MAX && group == ULLONG_MAX && argc == 1))
04228                 return CMD_HELP;
04229 
04230         memset(&data, 0, sizeof data);
04231         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
04232         if (argc == 1) {
04233                 fidstr = *argv;
04234                 while (*fidstr == '[')
04235                         fidstr++;
04236                 sscanf(fidstr, SFID, RFID(&fid));
04237 
04238                 data.ioc_inlbuf1 = (char *) &fid;
04239                 data.ioc_inllen1 = sizeof fid;
04240         } else {
04241                 data.ioc_inlbuf3 = (char *) &id;
04242                 data.ioc_inllen3 = sizeof id;
04243                 data.ioc_inlbuf4 = (char *) &group;
04244                 data.ioc_inllen4 = sizeof group;
04245         }
04246         data.ioc_inlbuf2 = (char *) &version;
04247         data.ioc_inllen2 = sizeof version;
04248 
04249         memset(buf, 0, sizeof *buf);
04250         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof rawbuf);
04251         if (rc) {
04252                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: packing ioctl arguments: %s\n",
04253                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(-rc));
04254                 return rc;
04255         }
04256 
04257         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_GET_OBJ_VERSION, buf);
04258         if (rc == -1) {
04259                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: ioctl: %s\n",
04260                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(errno));
04261                 return -errno;
04262         }
04263 
04264         obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof rawbuf);
04265         printf("%#jx\n", (uintmax_t)version);
04266         return 0;
04267 }
04268 
04269 int jt_changelog_register(int argc, char **argv)
04270 {
04271         struct obd_ioctl_data    data = { 0 };
04272         char                     rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN] = "";
04273         char                    *buf = rawbuf;
04274         char                    *device = lcfg_get_devname();
04275         bool                     print_name_only = false;
04276         int                      c;
04277         int                      rc;
04278 
04279         if (argc > 2)
04280                 return CMD_HELP;
04281 
04282         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "hn")) >= 0) {
04283                 switch (c) {
04284                 case 'n':
04285                         print_name_only = true;
04286                         break;
04287                 case 'h':
04288                 default:
04289                         return CMD_HELP;
04290                 }
04291         }
04292 
04293         if (cur_device < 0 || device == NULL)
04294                 return CMD_HELP;
04295 
04296         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
04297 
04298         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
04299         if (rc < 0) {
04300                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: cannot pack ioctl: %s\n",
04301                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), strerror(-rc));
04302                return rc;
04303         }
04304 
04305         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_REG, buf);
04306         if (rc < 0) {
04307                 rc = -errno;
04308                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
04309                         strerror(-rc));
04310                 return rc;
04311         }
04312 
04313         obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
04314 
04315         if (data.ioc_u32_1 == 0) {
04316                 fprintf(stderr, "received invalid userid!\n");
04317                 return -EPROTO;
04318         }
04319 
04320         if (print_name_only)
04321                 printf("%s%u\n", CHANGELOG_USER_PREFIX, data.ioc_u32_1);
04322         else
04323                 printf("%s: Registered changelog userid '%s%u'\n",
04324                        device, CHANGELOG_USER_PREFIX, data.ioc_u32_1);
04325 
04326         return 0;
04327 }
04328 
04329 int jt_changelog_deregister(int argc, char **argv)
04330 {
04331         struct obd_ioctl_data    data = { 0 };
04332         char                     rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN] = "";
04333         char                    *buf = rawbuf;
04334         char                    *device = lcfg_get_devname();
04335         int                      id;
04336         int                      rc;
04337 
04338         if (argc != 2 || cur_device < 0 || device == NULL)
04339                 return CMD_HELP;
04340 
04341         rc = sscanf(argv[1], CHANGELOG_USER_PREFIX"%d", &id);
04342         if (rc != 1 || id <= 0) {
04343                 fprintf(stderr,
04344                         "error: %s: expected id of the form %s<num> got '%s'\n",
04345                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]), CHANGELOG_USER_PREFIX, argv[1]);
04346                 return CMD_HELP;
04347         }
04348 
04349         data.ioc_dev = cur_device;
04350         data.ioc_u32_1 = id;
04351 
04352         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
04353         if (rc < 0) {
04354                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: invalid ioctl\n",
04355                         jt_cmdname(argv[0]));
04356                 return rc;
04357         }
04358 
04359         rc = l2_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_DEREG, buf);
04360         if (rc < 0) {
04361                 fprintf(stderr, "error: %s: %s\n", jt_cmdname(argv[0]),
04362                         strerror(rc = errno));
04363                 return rc;
04364         }
04365 
04366         obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
04367         printf("%s: Deregistered changelog user '%s%u'\n",
04368                device, CHANGELOG_USER_PREFIX, data.ioc_u32_1);
04369 
04370         return 0;
04371 }
